You said:
Below are leet code medium problems. I want you to analyze the problems and for questions you can use external sources. I want you group the problems in common themes, where are piece of knowledge can be applied across a group/class of problems. We want to then learn those core pieces of information in a stepwise fashion and be able to claim that is all the information required to solve the problems. The key trick is the core piece of information that we use group is not just common datastructures etc - the problems should be grouped according to common intuition need to solve the problem. you may want to create a knowledge tree where internal nodes are core concepts and leafs are problems that can be solved using those concepts. The graph may also take form of a DAG as concepts can refer to each other. Thus make a XML representation of this knowledge graph, where internal nodes are knowledge concepts and leafs/edge nodes are leet code problems. The end goal is for me grasp all the core concepts and then blaze through understanding of all problems without getting bogged down by overlapping back and forth / context switch of concepts. Render the XML such that it can be visualized as visualization using any tool of choice. Pay great attention to make this graph structured with an emphasis on building knowledge step wise. In cases some concepts have circular dependencies - untie the dependency to make 2/n clear paths. Connect such paths at the root. Minimum Number of Operations to Move All Balls to Each Box 90.3% 547. Number of Provinces 68.0% 393. UTF-8 Validation 45.4% 402. Remove K Digits 34.5% 916. Word Subsets 55.6% 1400. Find the Prefix Common Array of Two Arrays 87.7% 2013. Detect Squares 51.9% 2326. Spiral Matrix IV 82.2% 3428. Maximum and Minimum Sums of at Most Size K Subsequences 20.9% 92. Print Binary Tree 65.3% 994. Rotting Oranges 56.0% 1541. Minimum Insertions to Balance a Parentheses String 53.0% 2915. Length of the Longest Subsequence That Sums to Target 36.7% 2658. Maximum Number of Fish in a Grid 70.7% 939. Minimum Area Rectangle 54.8% 684. Redundant Connection 66.1% 373. Find K Pairs with Smallest Sums 40.4% 1448. Count Good Nodes in Binary Tree 73.3% 86. Partition List 58.4% 609. Find Duplicate File in System 67.6% 540. Single Element in a Sorted Array 59.2% 300. Longest Increasing Subsequence 57.2% 1838. Frequency of the Most Frequent Element 44.0% 1926. Nearest Exit from Entrance in Maze 47.3% 516. Longest Palindromic Subsequence 63.7% 1726. Tuple with Same Product 70.3% 213. Closest Prime Numbers in Range 51.7% 763. Partition Labels 80.2%
Assistant:
ChatGPT said:
Reasoned about LeetCode medium problems for 2m 50s

Below is a CSV with four columns:

  1. number (the canonical problem number)

  2. name (the LeetCode problem name)

  3. concept (a short note on core ideas or logic required)

  4. how_to_solve (a concise 1–3 sentence approach)

"2","Add Two Numbers","LinkedList addition, carry","Add digits node by node with carry, build a new result list. Keep track of carry for any leftover."
"3","Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters","Sliding window, hashing","Use two pointers and a set/map to track used chars. Move the start pointer when a char repeats, and record the max length."
"5","Longest Palindromic Substring","Expand around center / DP","For each center (character or gap), expand outwards to find palindromes. Keep track of the max length found."
"7","Reverse Integer","Math manipulations, handle overflow","Reverse digits by mod/div operations and build the result. Watch for overflow bounds."
"8","String to Integer (atoi)","String parsing, edge cases","Strip spaces, handle sign, parse digits until non-digit. Clamp to integer bounds if overflow occurs."
"11","Container With Most Water","Two-pointer approach","Start with left=0, right=n-1, compute area. Move the pointer with the smaller height inward, tracking max area."
"15","3Sum","Sorting + two-pointer","Sort the array, fix one number, then use two-pointer on the remainder. Skip duplicates and record valid triplets."
"16","3Sum Closest","Sorting + two-pointer","Sort, then fix one number and use two-pointer to find the best sum close to target. Track minimum difference."
"17","Letter Combinations of a Phone Number","Backtracking, phone keypad mapping","Map each digit to letters, then recursively build possible strings. Collect all valid letter combinations."
"18","4Sum","Sorting, two-pointer","Sort the array, fix two numbers, then two-pointer the remaining part. Carefully skip duplicates."
"19","Remove Nth Node From End of List","Linked list, fast/slow pointer","Move fast pointer n steps, then move both until fast hits null. Remove the slow pointer’s next node."
"22","Generate Parentheses","Backtracking with constraints","Recursively build parentheses strings, tracking count of '(' and ')'. Only add '(' if available, ')' if it won’t break validity."
"24","Swap Nodes in Pairs","Linked list node swaps","Swap every two adjacent nodes in the list. Update pointers carefully to maintain the linkage."
"29","Divide Two Integers","Math, bit manipulation","Simulate division by repeated subtraction or shifting. Handle overflow and sign properly."
"31","Next Permutation","Permutation rearrangement","From the end, find first decreasing pair. Swap with next larger element and reverse the suffix."
"33","Search in Rotated Sorted Array","Binary search variant","Identify which half is sorted based on mid vs boundaries. Narrow the search range accordingly."
"34","Find First and Last Position of Element in Sorted Array","Binary search boundaries","Use binary search to find the leftmost occurrence, then another to find the rightmost. Return [-1,-1] if not found."
"36","Valid Sudoku","Hash sets for row/col/box","For each row, column, and sub-box, ensure no duplicate digits. Use sets or direct boolean checks."
"38","Count and Say","String generation pattern","Iteratively build the next sequence by describing the previous term’s consecutive digits."
"40","Combination Sum II","Backtracking with sorted input","Sort, then backtrack while skipping duplicates. Only take each candidate once at a given level."
"43","Multiply Strings","String multiplication simulation","Multiply each digit of one string by each digit of the other, summing partial products. Handle carry and leading zeros."
"46","Permutations","Backtracking or swapping","Recursively choose each element as the first, swap, and generate permutations of the remainder."
"48","Rotate Image","Matrix transpose + reverse","Transpose the matrix, then reverse each row. That results in a 90-degree rotation in-place."
"49","Group Anagrams","Hashing by sorted key or char count","Sort each string or build a frequency key, store in a map from key to group of anagrams."
"50","Pow(x, n)","Fast exponentiation","Recursively divide n by 2, square the result. Handle odd exponents separately."
"53","Maximum Subarray","Kadane’s algorithm","Iterate while keeping track of the current sum, reset if it goes below zero. Maintain max sum encountered."
"54","Spiral Matrix","Simulation of boundary loops","Peel the matrix layer by layer in a spiral. Update boundaries (top/bottom/left/right) after each loop."
"55","Jump Game","Greedy max reach","Track the furthest index reachable. If you ever can’t advance to the next index, return false."
"56","Merge Intervals","Sorting and merging","Sort intervals by start. Merge overlapping intervals by taking the max end."
"57","Insert Interval","Intervals + merging","Locate insertion point, merge overlapping intervals, then insert the final merged result."
"62","Unique Paths","Combinatorics or DP","Either use the binomial formula (choose steps) or a DP grid counting ways to reach each cell."
"63","Unique Paths II","DP with obstacle handling","Same DP approach, but set dp cell to 0 if obstacle is there. Accumulate paths otherwise."
"71","Simplify Path","Stack for directories","Split the path on '/', push non-'..' to stack, pop on '..', skip '.' or empty segments. Join stack to form final path."
"72","Edit Distance","DP for string transformations","dp[i][j] = 1 + min of replace/delete/insert, or dp[i-1][j-1] if chars match. Fill up the table."
"73","Set Matrix Zeroes","Matrix marking approach","Track which rows/cols should be zero using extra structures or first row/col. Zero them in a second pass."
"75","Sort Colors","Dutch National Flag algorithm","Use three pointers for 0, 1, 2. Swap to place 0s in front, 2s at end."
"78","Subsets","Backtracking or bitmask","Generate all subsets via recursion or bitwise enumeration. Collect them in a result list."
"79","Word Search","DFS backtracking on board","For each cell, DFS to match the word. Mark visited to avoid reusing the same cell."
"80","Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array II","Array manipulation, pointer approach","Allow each element up to two occurrences. Overwrite beyond that limit in-place."
"74","Search a 2D Matrix","Binary search","Either flatten conceptually and do 1D binary search, or do row-col approach. Compare mid value with target."
"93","Restore IP Addresses","Backtracking + segment validation","Partition string into 4 segments, each 0-255. If used all digits correctly, record the result."
"98","Validate Binary Search Tree","Recursion with range bounds","Check each node’s value is within min/max, recurse left/right. Return false if out of bounds."
"102","Binary Tree Level Order Traversal","BFS by levels","Queue the root, pop level nodes, push children. Collect levels in a list of lists."
"103","Binary Tree Zigzag Level Order Traversal","BFS with direction toggle","Same as level order, but reverse the list on alternate levels."
"105","Construct Binary Tree from Preorder and Inorder Traversal","Tree construction with index lookups","Preorder[0] is root, find it in inorder. Recursively build left subtree and right subtree."
"113","Path Sum II","DFS path building","Track running sum down each path. If leaf sum equals target, add path to result."
"114","Flatten Binary Tree to Linked List","DFS, pointer re-linking","Flatten left subtree, attach it between node and right subtree. Re-link and continue recursively."
"116","Populating Next Right Pointers in Each Node","Tree BFS or perfect tree recursion","Use level order or connect children as you go. Each node’s next = node’s right sibling in BFS."
"128","Longest Consecutive Sequence","Set or union-find","Insert all numbers in a set, for each number check consecutive neighbors. Track the longest streak."
"129","Sum Root to Leaf Numbers","DFS building integer","Pass the current value*10 + node.val down. Sum at leaves."
"131","Palindrome Partitioning","Backtracking + palindrome check","Partition string and check each substring is palindrome. Collect all valid ways."
"133","Clone Graph","Graph BFS/DFS cloning","Keep a map old->new node. Traverse, creating cloned neighbors recursively or iteratively."
"138","Copy List with Random Pointer","Linked list mapping or weaving","Either store old->new in a hash map, or weave cloned nodes in the original, then fix random links."
"139","Word Break","DP substring checks","dp[i] is true if substring(0..i) can be broken into dictionary words. Check all j < i for substring in set."
"146","LRU Cache","Design with doubly linked list + hash","Use a hash map for O(1) access. A linked list tracks recency, moving recently accessed to the front."
"150","Evaluate Reverse Polish Notation","Stack for RPN","Iterate tokens, push numbers, pop top two on operator, compute, push result. Return final stack top."
"152","Maximum Product Subarray","DP tracking min/max up to current","Negative flips min and max. Keep track of global maximum."
"153","Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array","Binary search pivot","Compare mid to edges. Narrow down to the segment where min lies."
"151","Reverse Words in a String","String manipulation","Split by spaces, reverse the words, and rejoin. Trim extra spaces."
"162","Find Peak Element","Binary search or linear check","In O(log n), compare mid with mid+1 to decide which half to search. Or linearly check neighbors."
"167","Two Sum II - Input Array Is Sorted","Two-pointer in sorted array","Start left=0, right=n-1, compare sum to target, adjust pointers inward."
"173","Binary Search Tree Iterator","Inorder stack approach","Push left nodes, pop top as next. After pop, push the node’s right subtree left path."
"189","Rotate Array","Reverse array or use auxiliary array","Reverse entire array, then reverse the two parts. Or shift elements using temp array."
"198","House Robber","DP on linear houses","dp[i] = max of dp[i-1] or nums[i] + dp[i-2]. Final dp[n-1] is the answer."
"199","Binary Tree Right Side View","BFS or DFS with right-first","At each level, record the rightmost node. Or do a DFS with level track and store first visit."
"200","Number of Islands","DFS/BFS on grid","Traverse the grid, for each unvisited land, run DFS/BFS to mark the connected region, increment count."
"207","Course Schedule","Graph cycle detection / topological sort","Create adjacency list. If there's a cycle, no solution. Otherwise, can finish courses."
"209","Minimum Size Subarray Sum","Sliding window for subarray sum","Move end pointer, accumulate sum, shrink from start if sum >= target. Track min length."
"210","Course Schedule II","Topological sort","Use Kahn’s or DFS to produce a valid course order. If cycle, return empty array."
"215","Kth Largest Element in an Array","Heap or quickselect","Use a min-heap of size k or partition approach. Return the k-th largest after partial sort."
"227","Basic Calculator II","Stack or direct parse","Parse expression tokens. Use stack to store numbers, handle * / immediately. Compute + - at the end."
"235","Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Search Tree","BST property: compare values","Traverse from root. If both nodes < root, go left; if both > root, go right; else root is LCA."
"236","Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree","Tree recursion","Recurse down; if we find p or q, bubble up. If both sides non-null, current node is LCA."
"238","Product of Array Except Self","Prefix/suffix multiplication","Compute prefix products, then multiply with suffix product in second pass. O(1) extra space aside from output."
"249","Group Shifted Strings","Hash pattern differences","For each string, build a relative shift signature. Group strings with identical shift signatures."
"253","Meeting Rooms II","Min-heap or timeline approach","Sort intervals by start, use a min-heap to track end times. Or separate start/end arrays and track usage."
"286","Walls and Gates","Multi-source BFS","Put all gates (distance=0) in queue initially. BFS outward to fill distances to the nearest gate."
"2265","Count Nodes Equal to Average of Subtree","Tree DFS for sum & count","Compute subtree sum and count. If node’s val == (sum/count), increment result."
"314","Binary Tree Vertical Order Traversal","BFS with column indices","Use a queue storing (node, col). Collect values in a map col->list, then output col-sorted lists."
"333","Largest BST Subtree","Tree recursion with subtree info","Return subtree size, min, max, isBST. If node is BST, update global max size."
"334","Increasing Triplet Subsequence","Greedy track two smallest","Maintain two pointers for smallest and mid. If we find a bigger number than mid, triplet exists."
"339","Nested List Weight Sum","DFS or BFS of nested structure","At each level, multiply integer by depth. Recursively add or BFS with a queue tracking depth."
"341","Flatten Nested List Iterator","Stack-based flatten","Repeatedly expand top if it's a list. If it's an integer, that's our next element."
"347","Top K Frequent Elements","Heap or bucket sort","Count frequencies, push to a min-heap or use bucket by frequency. Extract top K frequent."
"348","Design Tic-Tac-Toe","Rows, cols, diag counters","For each player, increment row/col/diag counts. If absolute value hits n, that player wins."
"378","Kth Smallest Element in a Sorted Matrix","Heap or binary searching by value","Use a min-heap or binary search in the value range. Count how many elements <= mid to narrow search."
"380","Insert Delete GetRandom O(1)","HashMap + dynamic array","For O(1) insert/delete, store values in an array and map their index. For random, pick a random array index."
"394","Decode String","Stack or recursion","Push current string and number on stack when encountering '['. On ']', pop and build repeated substring."
"398","Random Pick Index","Reservoir sampling or storing indices","Maintain a list of indices per value, then pick random. Or do reservoir sampling as you traverse."
"419","Battleships in a Board","Grid scanning","Count a battleship when you see 'X' that isn’t a continuation (above/left). Mark visited or just check adjacency."
"424","Longest Repeating Character Replacement","Sliding window + frequency","Grow the window, track count of most frequent char. If window size - max_freq > k, shrink from left."
"443","String Compression","Two-pointer in-place","Track runs of the same character. Store the count digits and move on, returning final length."
"468","Validate IP Address","String split and format checks","Split by '.' or ':', check valid range or hex length. Distinguish IPv4, IPv6, or neither."
"490","The Maze","DFS/BFS rolling approach","Roll the ball in each direction until hitting a wall. Mark visited states, check if you can reach the goal."
"494","Target Sum","DFS or subset-sum DP","We want ways to assign +/- to reach target. Transform to subset sum or backtrack all possibilities."
"498","Diagonal Traverse","Simulation of diagonals","Traverse diagonals by sum of indices. Reverse direction every alternate diagonal."
"523","Continuous Subarray Sum","Prefix sum mod k","Compute prefix sum % k, store in a map. If the same mod reappears with distance > 1, subarray sum is multiple of k."
"525","Contiguous Array","Prefix sum (0 -> -1, 1 -> +1)","Map prefix sums to index. If sum repeats, subarray in between has equal 0 and 1."
"529","Minesweeper","DFS/BFS reveal squares","If a revealed cell has 0 adjacent mines, recursively reveal its neighbors. Stop if you hit a mine or no expansions left."
"536","Construct Binary Tree from String","Recursion with parentheses parse","Parse the string: first number is root, parentheses sections represent left/right subtrees."
"545","Boundary of Binary Tree","Tree traversal boundary","Collect left boundary, leaves, and right boundary in reverse. Avoid double counting corners."
"556","Next Greater Element III","Permutation next greater logic","Treat digits like next permutation. If not possible, return -1."
"560","Subarray Sum Equals K","Prefix sum + hashing","Keep running sum in a map. If sum - k exists, increment count by how many times that remainder appeared."
"636","Exclusive Time of Functions","Stack of function calls + timestamps","Push function id on 'start', pop on 'end', accumulate intervals. Subtract nested intervals from parent."
"647","Palindromic Substrings","Expand around center or DP","For each center, expand outwards while it’s a palindrome. Count all valid centers."
"658","Find K Closest Elements","Binary search or two-pointer","Locate position of x, then expand outwards or do a binary search for the left boundary of size k. Return slice."
"670","Maximum Swap","Greedy digit swap from left","Scan from left, find a bigger digit on the right that can be swapped. Perform once for max number."
"695","Max Area of Island","DFS/BFS in grid","For each unvisited '1', explore the entire connected region. Track the maximum area found."
"721","Accounts Merge","Union-Find or DFS on email lists","Merge accounts with shared emails. Sort final results by name/email."
"735","Asteroid Collision","Stack approach","Push new asteroid. If collision occurs with top of stack, pop smaller or break if stack top is bigger."
"739","Daily Temperatures","Monotonic stack","Traverse from right or maintain a stack of indices. Pop while top is cooler, the difference is the answer."
"426","Convert Binary Search Tree to Sorted Doubly Linked List","Inorder traversal link","Perform an inorder DFS, link previous node to current. Finally link head and tail to make it circular."
"787","Cheapest Flights Within K Stops","Shortest path with limited stops (Bellman-Ford or BFS)","Track cost to each node up to K edges. Update in a BFS/relaxation manner."
"791","Custom Sort String","Custom priority sort","Store order in a dict of char->rank. Sort the input string’s characters by that rank, append leftover."
"708","Insert into a Sorted Circular Linked List","Linked list insertion logic","Traverse until insertion point or wrap around. Insert new node maintaining sorted order."
"825","Friends Of Appropriate Ages","Sorting & two-pointer on age constraints","Sort ages, for each age find valid range. Use prefix sums or pointers to skip invalid combos."
"622","Design Circular Queue","Array with front/rear indices","Implement a fixed-size array queue that wraps around. Track count, front, and rear positions."
"852","Peak Index in a Mountain Array","Binary search for peak","Compare mid with mid+1. If ascending, move right; else move left until peak found."
"863","All Nodes Distance K in Binary Tree","BFS/DFS from target node","First store parent references, then BFS from target node to find nodes at distance K."
"865","Smallest Subtree with all the Deepest Nodes","Tree DFS, depth tracking","Identify deepest level, find the subtree containing all deepest nodes. Essentially LCA of deepest leaves."
"528","Random Pick with Weight","Prefix sums + random selection","Compute prefix sums of weights, pick a random in [0,total). Binary search for the segment."
"921","Minimum Add to Make Parentheses Valid","Balance counters","Track needed '(' or ')'. Each time there's an unmatched ')', increment needed. Return total needed."
"930","Binary Subarrays With Sum","Prefix sum in 0/1 array","Similar to subarray-sum equals K. Map prefix sums, subarray if current_sum - target in map."
"934","Shortest Bridge","DFS + BFS across islands","Find the first island via DFS, add it to a queue, BFS outward to reach second island in min steps."
"958","Check Completeness of a Binary Tree","BFS level order checking","Traverse level by level, once a null is found, ensure no more non-null nodes appear."
"973","K Closest Points to Origin","Heap or quickselect","Compute distance squared, keep a max-heap of size k or do partition-based quickselect."
"983","Minimum Cost For Tickets","DP with intervals","For each travel day, cost = min of day pass, 7-day pass, 30-day pass. Build DP up to last day."
"986","Interval List Intersections","Merge intervals method","Use two pointers on the two lists, intersect the overlapping intervals, advance pointer that ends first."
"1004","Max Consecutive Ones III","Sliding window, count zero","Expand window. If zero count exceeds k, shrink from left. Track max window size."
"1011","Capacity To Ship Packages Within D Days","Binary search on capacity","Check if a mid capacity can ship within D days. If not, increase capacity, else lower it."
"1060","Missing Element in Sorted Array","Binary search using the missing counts","At index i, how many are missing up to nums[i]? If < k, go right; else go left."
"1091","Shortest Path in Binary Matrix","BFS in 8 directions","Start from (0,0) if not blocked, BFS for the shortest path to (n-1,n-1). Track visited cells."
"1209","Remove All Adjacent Duplicates in String II","Stack-based count","Push characters and track frequency. If the frequency hits k, pop them."
"1249","Minimum Remove to Make Valid Parentheses","Stack or scanning mismatches","Push '(' indices, match with ')' or mark invalid ones. Remove unmatched parentheses in the end."
"1424","Diagonal Traverse II","Group by i+j in a map","Traverse row-wise, append to map keyed by (i+j). Flatten in the correct order."
"1443","Minimum Time to Collect All Apples in a Tree","DFS subtrees with apple-check","From root, visit children. Include path cost if a child subtree contains an apple."
"1570","Dot Product of Two Sparse Vectors","Sparse representation iteration","Store non-zero indices and values. Multiply only indices in common."
"1650","Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree III","Nodes have parent pointers","Ascend from each node or equalize depths first. Move both up until they meet."
"1762","Buildings With an Ocean View","Stack or scanning from the right","Traverse from right, track max height. Buildings taller than all to the right have a view."
"1778","Shortest Path in a Hidden Grid","Interactive BFS/DFS concept","We do BFS steps, learning adjacency dynamically. Keep track of visited to find minimal route."
"1868","Product of Two Run-Length Encoded Arrays","Two pointers on runs","Multiply each run chunk while adjusting counts. Output in RLE form."
"1070","Product Sales Analysis III","SQL grouping and joining","Combine tables to get total product sales. GROUP BY product, possibly with subqueries or joins."
"322","Coin Change","DP for the fewest coins","dp[x] = min(dp[x], dp[x-coin] + 1). Initialize dp[0]=0, otherwise large. If dp[amount] not updated, return -1."
"328","Odd Even Linked List","Linked list rearrangement","Put odd indices first, even indices next. Update pointers so that all odds connect, then all evens."
"912","Sort an Array","Implementation of standard sorts","Use quicksort, mergesort, or heapsort. Return the sorted array."
"1344","Angle Between Hands of a Clock","Math formula","Compute minute hand angle and hour hand angle. Return the absolute difference, mod 360 if needed."
"91","Decode Ways","DP on string decoding","dp[i] can come from single digit or two-digit decode if valid. Summation yields total ways."
"117","Populating Next Right Pointers in Each Node II","Level order BFS linking","Traverse level by level, link nodes horizontally. Keep track of next level head and tail."
"161","One Edit Distance","Check single insert/delete/replace","If lengths differ, see if one insert can fix. If same length, check if only one replace is needed."
"1586","Binary Search Tree Iterator II","BST iteration with backtracking","Like BST Iterator but we store visited nodes to allow backward iteration as well."
"1123","Lowest Common Ancestor of Deepest Leaves","DFS depth + LCA logic","Find max depth, then LCA of all deepest. Recurse subtrees to see if children contain deepest leaves."
"325","Maximum Size Subarray Sum Equals k","Prefix sum map","Track running sum. If sum-k in map, check index difference for max length."
"377","Combination Sum IV","DP counting combos","dp[target] += dp[target - num] if target >= num. Order matters if we iterate over nums first."
"1810","Minimum Path Cost in a Hidden Grid","Similar BFS with hidden adjacency","We query cost of edges on the fly, track minimal path in BFS. Keep visited states or cost."
"237","Delete Node in a Linked List","In-place pointer swap","Copy data from next node into current, then skip the next node. This effectively removes current."
"143","Reorder List","Linked list re-linking","Find midpoint, reverse second half, then interleave it with the first half."
"82","Remove Duplicates from Sorted List II","Linked list skip duplicates","Use dummy head, skip over nodes that appear more than once. Link only distinct nodes."
"179","Largest Number","Custom sorting by string comparison","Sort numbers by comparing xy vs yx (string concat). Join them afterward."
"45","Jump Game II","Greedy BFS layering","Track current reach and next reach. When current index surpasses the current reach, increment jumps."
"450","Delete Node in a BST","BST node manipulation","Find the node. If two children, swap with successor or predecessor. Then remove leaf or single-child node."
"134","Gas Station","Greedy solution","If total gas < total cost, no solution. Otherwise, track deficits and pick the start index after them."
"1609","Even Odd Tree","Tree BFS + constraints","For each level, nodes must be strictly increasing/decreasing and follow even/odd pattern. Validate or fail."
"875","Koko Eating Bananas","Binary search on eating speed","Check if a mid speed can eat all bananas in H hours. Adjust boundaries accordingly."
"230","Kth Smallest Element in a BST","Inorder traversal","Traverse in sorted order. The kth visited node is the kth smallest."
"1371","Find the Longest Substring Containing Vowels in Even Counts","Bitmask prefix approach","Track parity of each vowel in an integer mask. If mask repeats, substring between them has even counts."
"2419","Longest Subarray With Maximum Bitwise AND","Scan for segments matching global max","First find the maximum value in array. Then find the longest consecutive segment of that value."
"539","Minimum Time Difference","Convert times to minutes, sort","Check adjacent differences, also consider wrap-around from end to start. Return min difference."
"567","Permutation in String","Sliding window + frequency","Keep a frequency count of s1. Slide over s2 with window size |s1|. If freq matches, return true."
"416","Partition Equal Subset Sum","DP subset sum","If total sum is odd, no. Otherwise, check if we can form sum/2 using subset-sum DP."
"122","Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II","Greedy for multiple transactions","Sum all positive differences between consecutive days. This captures the max profit from unlimited transactions."
"386","Lexicographical Numbers","DFS or iterative approach","Generate from 1...n in lex order by branching *10. Or transform numbers to strings and sort them."
"340","Longest Substring with At Most K Distinct Characters","Sliding window with char count","Expand window, track distinct count. If > k, shrink from left. Track max length."
"3043","Find the Length of the Longest Common Prefix","Simple prefix check among strings","Compare characters across all strings until mismatch. Return length of matched prefix."
"81","Search in Rotated Sorted Array II","Binary search with duplicates","Similar to #33 but if nums[mid]==nums[left], move left++. Otherwise do the usual pivot logic."
"1367","Linked List in Binary Tree","DFS checking subpath","For each tree node, see if it matches the head of list. Recursively match subsequent list nodes."
"767","Reorganize String","Greedy with a max heap or sorting by freq","If any char’s freq > half the string length (rounded up), impossible. Otherwise alternate the most frequent chars."
"371","Sum of Two Integers","Bitwise ops","Use XOR for sum, AND << 1 for carry. Repeat until carry is zero."
"1590","Make Sum Divisible by P","Prefix sum remainder approach","Find total sum%p=remain. We want subarray whose sum%p=remain to remove. Track prefix remainders in a map."
"96","Unique Binary Search Trees","Catalan number / DP","Number of BSTs for n is the nth Catalan. Or use DP: G(n)=Σ(G(i-1)*G(n-i))."
"12","Integer to Roman","Greedy from largest roman values","Keep subtracting the largest possible symbol value, append the symbol. Continue until zero."
"1644","Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree II","Similar to LCA but confirm nodes exist","If one node not in tree, result is null. Use normal LCA logic, verifying both are found."
"1110","Delete Nodes And Return Forest","Tree DFS cut approach","For each node in to_delete, cut it out. Return the remaining subtrees as a forest."
"1497","Check If Array Pairs Are Divisible by k","Hash mod frequencies","Compute each num%k, must pair with complementary (k - remainder). Check frequency balance."
"2406","Divide Intervals Into Minimum Number of Groups","Interval scheduling with min-heap","Sort by start time. Keep a heap of end times, or assign to new group if overlap."
"2090","K Radius Subarray Averages","Sliding window or prefix sums","For each i, the average is sum over [i-k..i+k]. Validate boundaries and compute quickly with prefix sums."
"287","Find the Duplicate Number","Floyd’s cycle detection or binary search","Use slow/fast pointer to detect cycle, then locate entry. Or binary search count of <= mid to find duplicate."
"1233","Remove Sub-Folders from the Filesystem","Sort + prefix check","Sort folder names, skip a folder if it’s a subpath of the previous (i.e., prefix plus '/')."
"1545","Find Kth Bit in Nth Binary String","Recursive pattern (S(n)=S(n-1)+0+switch(reverse(S(n-1))))","Use recursion or find position patterns. Flip bits if needed when indexing beyond S(n-1)."
"453","Minimum Moves to Equal Array Elements","Sum approach minus min","Each move increments n-1 elements. Equivalent to sum(array) - min(array)*n."
"1593","Split a String Into the Max Number of Unique Substrings","Backtracking with used-set","Try all substr splits. If not used, pick it and recurse to find maximum partitions."
"1438","Longest Continuous Subarray With Absolute Diff ≤ Limit","Sliding window + min/max queue","Keep track of window’s min and max in O(1). If the diff is too big, shrink from the left."
"2461","Maximum Sum of Distinct Subarrays With Length K","Sliding window with distinct check","Move a window of size K, ensure no duplicates. Track sum, use freq map or set."
"1891","Cutting Ribbons","Binary search for max length","Check if mid is feasible by counting how many pieces we get. If enough, go bigger, else smaller."
"229","Majority Element II","Boyer-Moore for two candidates","We can have up to 2 majority elements > n/3. Find potential candidates then verify them."
"1197","Minimum Knight Moves","BFS or math symmetry","Use BFS from (0,0) to (x,y). Exploit symmetry to reduce to positive quadrant for efficiency."
"814","Binary Tree Pruning","DFS postorder","Recursively prune subtrees that have no 1. Return null if entire subtree is 0s."
"109","Convert Sorted List to Binary Search Tree","Slow/fast pointer find mid","Mid becomes root, left side builds left subtree, right side builds right subtree. Recurse."
"2501","Longest Square Streak in an Array","DP or set approach for squares","If x in array, check x^2 in set, chain up squares. Track max length of such chain."
"435","Non-overlapping Intervals","Greedy by end time","Sort by end, pick intervals that finish earliest. Skip intervals that overlap the chosen one."
"1498","Number of Subsequences That Satisfy the Given Sum Condition","Sort + two-pointer + pow(2) usage","Sort array, for each left pointer find max right pointer. Count subsets using powers of 2 mod."
"137","Single Number II","Bit manipulation counting bits mod 3","Sum bits in each position mod 3. The remainder forms the unique number."
"616","Add Bold Tag in String","Mark intervals and merge","Find all occurrences of words, merge intervals, then wrap them with <b> tags in the final string."
"240","Search a 2D Matrix II","Start top-right corner, move left/down","If target < current, go left. If target > current, go down. This prunes rows/columns."
"2914","Minimum Number of Changes to Make Binary String Beautiful","Check flips to get alternating pattern","Compute cost for '0101...' vs '1010...' across the string. Take min."
"3011","Find if Array Can Be Sorted","Likely checking partial swaps or some condition","Possibly verify if the array can be fully sorted by limited operations. Check constraints or adjacency."
"1493","Longest Subarray of 1's After Deleting One Element","Sliding window tracking zero count","Expand window, if more than one zero, shrink from left. Track max length of 1s."
"6","Zigzag Conversion","Simulation row-by-row","Append chars in a zigzag manner across rows, then read rows sequentially to form the result."
"3133","Minimum Array End","(Problem-specific, partial info)","Likely a minimal step or BFS approach. Focus on constraints, possibly remove from ends or dynamic strategy."
"2034","Stock Price Fluctuation","Design with data structures","Track current timestamp price, store all in a map or heaps for max/min. Update as new records come in."
"3097","Shortest Subarray With OR at Least K II","Sliding window + bitwise OR","Expand window, accumulate OR. If >= K, shrink from left. Keep track of min length."
"510","Inorder Successor in BST II","BST with parent pointer","If node has right subtree, go left from right child. Otherwise, ascend parent until child is a left branch."
"1845","Seat Reservation Manager","Min-heap of seats","Keep a min-heap of available seats. On reserve, pop the smallest. On unreserve, push it back."
"1574","Shortest Subarray to be Removed to Make Array Sorted","Two-pointer from ends","Find the longest sorted prefix and suffix. Then remove the minimal middle that breaks order."
"451","Sort Characters By Frequency","Count + sort desc frequency","Build frequency map, sort chars by frequency descending. Construct final string."
"1382","Balance a Binary Search Tree","Inorder flatten + build balanced","Traverse BST in inorder to get sorted list. Rebuild balanced BST from that list."
"723","Candy Crush","Simulation of collapses","Repeatedly remove matched candy blocks, drop candies above, continue until stable."
"856","Score of Parentheses","Stack or counting depth","Push '(' onto stack, on ')' compute 1 if it was "()". Otherwise 2 * stack top if nested."
"1161","Maximum Level Sum of a Binary Tree","BFS level sums","Compute sum for each level, track which level has the max sum."
"77","Combinations","Backtracking k-combinations","Choose elements from 1..n with recursion. Collect all combinations of length k."
"907","Sum of Subarray Minimums","Monotonic stack to find each element's subarray coverage","For each element, find how far left/right it remains the min. Accumulate contribution."
"692","Top K Frequent Words","Frequency + min-heap or sorting","Count freq, use a min-heap of size k or sort by freq desc then lexicographical ascending."
"918","Maximum Sum Circular Subarray","Kadane’s or invert approach","Compute normal max subarray. Then find min subarray and subtract from total if not all negative."
"678","Valid Parenthesis String","Greedy track min/max open","For '(' => min++, max++. For ')' => min--, max-- but min≥0 => set to 0 if negative. If max<0, invalid."
"417","Pacific Atlantic Water Flow","DFS from edges inward","Start from each ocean boundary, mark reachable. Intersection of reachable from both is the result."
"176","Second Highest Salary","SQL ranking or subquery","SELECT max(Salary) where Salary < (SELECT max(Salary)) from Employee. Or use limit offset in some dialect."
"247","Strobogrammatic Number II","Recursion building symmetrical pairs","Place pairs (1,1), (6,9), (8,8), (9,6), (0,0). Middle can be (0,1,8) if length odd."
"1358","Number of Substrings Containing All Three Characters","Sliding window for 'a','b','c'","Expand window until all three present, then shrink from left while valid. Count the new valid substrings."
"2109","Adding Spaces to a String","String building with known indices","Track the positions where spaces go. Reconstruct the result by inserting spaces at those indices."
"1029","Two City Scheduling","Greedy sorting by cost difference","Sort persons by difference in flying cost (A - B). Send the first half to one city, the rest to the other."
"1245","Tree Diameter","Double DFS approach","Pick any node, DFS to find the farthest node. From that node, DFS again to find the farthest distance. That distance is the diameter."
"1679","Max Number of K-Sum Pairs","Sorting + two-pointer or map freq","Sort and use left/right pointers. If sum < k, move left; if sum>k, move right; else count pair and move both."
"2337","Move Pieces to Obtain a String","Greedy alignment check of 'L'/'R'","Positions of 'L' can’t move right, positions of 'R' can’t move left. Check if transformation is feasible in order."
"388","Longest Absolute File Path","Stack or counting depth from '\t'","Split input by lines, track current path length in a stack. Update max length for files."
"395","Longest Substring with At Least K Repeating Characters","Divide and conquer or sliding window","If a char's freq < k, split around it. Otherwise entire substring is valid."
"2981","Find Longest Special Substring That Occurs Thrice I","String hashing / suffix array approach","Likely do a binary search on substring length, check if it appears 3 times via hash or suffix structure."
"382","Linked List Random Node","Reservoir sampling for single item","Traverse nodes, replace the chosen node with probability 1/i. Return final choice."
"2593","Find Score of an Array After Marking All Elements","Greedy or DP approach (problem-specific)","Pick smallest unmarked, add to score, mark neighbors. Possibly a sorted approach."
"2125","Number of Laser Beams in a Bank","Multiply device counts in consecutive non-empty rows","For each row, count '1's. Multiply consecutive row device counts to add to total."
"1277","Count Square Submatrices with All Ones","DP counting squares","dp[i][j] = 1 + min of neighbors if cell==1. Sum dp values for total squares."
"1094","Car Pooling","Prefix difference or min-heap","Record passenger changes at start/end, accumulate. Check if capacity exceeded at any point."
"503","Next Greater Element II","Monotonic stack, circular array","Traverse array twice (mod index). Pop smaller elements to find next greater for each index."
"729","My Calendar I","Interval booking check","Keep a data structure of intervals. Before adding, check if it overlaps with existing. Return true if success."
"2352","Equal Row and Column Pairs","Compare row patterns with column patterns","Build row strings in a map. For each column, build a string, see how many row matches exist."
"515","Find Largest Value in Each Tree Row","BFS track max in each level","For each level, track the maximum node value. Append to result."
"1980","Find Unique Binary String","Diagonal or backtracking approach","Take the i-th bit from i-th string and flip it to ensure uniqueness. This 'diagonal flip' guarantees difference."
"1014","Best Sightseeing Pair","DP track best (A[i]+i) while scanning","We want max of A[i]+A[j]+(i-j). Keep a running best of A[i]+i, update result with that plus A[j]-j."
"155","Min Stack","Stack with a min tracker","Push normal stack and track current min in parallel. On pop, restore the min from the secondary structure."
"2466","Count Ways To Build Good Strings","DP with steps or zero/one increments","dp[i] can be built from dp[i-zero] + dp[i-one]. Possibly handle mod."
"1055","Shortest Way to Form String","Greedy scanning of S to build T","Repeatedly match a subsequence of S to a chunk of T until T is fully formed. Count how many subsequences used."
"310","Minimum Height Trees","BFS from leaves inward","Peel off leaf nodes level by level. The final remaining one(s) form the tree's MHT root(s)."
"542","01 Matrix","Multi-source BFS from all zero cells","Put all zero positions in queue, BFS outward, each step’s distance is 1 more than predecessor."
"2270","Number of Ways to Split Array","Prefix sums vs suffix sums","We want splits where prefix >= suffix. For index i, check if sum(0..i) >= sum(i+1..end). Count valid i."
"1930","Unique Length-3 Palindromic Subsequences","Track positions of each character","For each char as outer pair, count distinct different middle chars. Tally total unique triplets."
"438","Find All Anagrams in a String","Sliding window freq compare","Keep freq of chars in 'p'. Slide a window of size len(p) over 's', check if frequencies match."
"2381","Shifting Letters II","Prefix approach on shift ranges","For each [start,end,direction], track shift in prefix array. Apply cumulative shifts to build final string."
"130","Surrounded Regions","DFS/BFS from board edges","Mark 'O' connected to edges as safe. Flip the unmarked 'O's to 'X', revert marked to 'O'."
"1769","Minimum Number of Operations to Move All Balls to Each Box","Prefix sums or counting distances","We can sum distance to each box. Two passes or prefix sums help compute in O(n)."
"547","Number of Provinces","Union-Find or DFS adjacency","If matrix[i][j]==1, union sets i and j. Count distinct connected components in the end."
"393","UTF-8 Validation","Check leading bits of each byte","Check how many leading 1 bits for the first byte, then verify subsequent bytes start with '10'."
"402","Remove K Digits","Monotonic stack to keep smaller digits","Pop while top is larger than the current digit and k>0. If leftover k remains, remove from end."
"916","Word Subsets","Frequency requirement across B","Compute the max freq needed for each letter from B. Check each A to ensure it meets or exceeds that freq."
"1400","Construct K Palindrome Strings","Check number of odd freq chars","If # of odd freq characters > k, impossible. Otherwise we can rearrange to form k palindrome strings."
"2116","Check if a Parentheses String Can Be Valid","Greedy or partial lock approach","We have locked parentheses. Possibly track min/max open, flipping where possible if not locked."
"1062","Longest Repeating Substring","Binary search + rolling hash or suffix structures","Try mid length, see if substring repeats. If yes, go bigger, else smaller."
"2348","Number of Zero-Filled Subarrays","Count consecutive zero segments","If you have a run of length L zeroes, it contributes L*(L+1)/2 subarrays."
"2657","Find the Prefix Common Array of Two Arrays","Set-based or index-based counting","At each prefix i, count how many elements appear in both arrays up to i. Possibly keep sets or freq."
"2013","Detect Squares","Hash points by x or y","For each new point, check potential square corners. Maintain freq of points in a data structure."
"2326","Spiral Matrix IV","Spiral fill with linked list","Traverse matrix in spiral order, placing linked list values. Once done or list empty, stop."
"3428","Maximum and Minimum Sums of at Most Size K Subsequences","Likely sliding window or choose subsequences","Possibly partial known: we either pick up to K subsequences to maximize/minimize sum. Need a strategy or sorting."
"92","Reverse Linked List II","Linked list partial reverse","Find node m and n, then reverse that subrange in place. Reconnect sublists."
"271","Encode and Decode Strings","Delim or length-prefix approach","Encode by storing length + separator. Decode by reading length then substring."
"39","Combination Sum","Backtracking with unlimited usage","Pick a candidate multiple times or skip it. Collect combos that sum to target."
"1267","Count Servers that Communicate","Row/col counting in a grid","Server communicates if it shares row or column with another server. Count such servers."
"802","Find Eventual Safe States","Graph cycle detection","A node is safe if it doesn’t lead to a cycle. Topological approach or DFS color to detect cycles."
"61","Rotate List","Linked list rotate by k steps","Link tail to head (circular), then break at the correct position. Reassign new head."
"655","Print Binary Tree","DFS placing nodes in the correct position","Find tree height for matrix dimensions. Recursively place each node in mid of range."
"994","Rotting Oranges","Multi-source BFS from rotten oranges","Push all rotten into queue initially, BFS each minute. Track fresh oranges count or time."
"1541","Minimum Insertions to Balance a Parentheses String","Greedy to form complete pairs","We need '(' and ')' in pairs. Track open count, insert if mismatch."
"2915","Length of the Longest Subsequence That Sums to Target","Likely DP or backtracking approach","We want the max length subsequence that equals target. Standard subset-sum with an extra dimension for length."
"2658","Maximum Number of Fish in a Grid","DFS/BFS with sum of fish","Similar to max island area but each cell has fish count. Find the max connected sum."
"939","Minimum Area Rectangle","Use points set to find rectangle corners","For each pair of points in the same row, check if the corresponding pair in another row exists. Track min area."
"684","Redundant Connection","Union-Find in a tree","Add edges, if an edge connects two nodes already in the same set, that's the redundant one."
"373","Find K Pairs with Smallest Sums","Heap approach or k-limited BFS","Push the pair (nums1[i], nums2[j]) with sum. Pop the smallest, possibly push next from row/col."
"1448","Count Good Nodes in Binary Tree","DFS track max so far","If current node ≥ max so far, increment result. Update max and recurse children."
"86","Partition List","Linked list partition by x","Build two lists: < x and ≥ x. Concatenate them in the end."
"609","Find Duplicate File in System","Map file contents -> list of paths","Parse each path, store content as key in map. Duplicate if multiple paths share content."
"540","Single Element in a Sorted Array","Binary search on pairs","Every pair is matched except the single. Compare mid with neighbors to decide search direction."
"300","Longest Increasing Subsequence","DP or patience sorting","DP: dp[i]=1+max(dp[j]) for j<i if arr[j]<arr[i]. Or maintain a tails array for an O(n log n) solution."
"1838","Frequency of the Most Frequent Element","Sliding window + prefix sums","Keep a window, sum of elements plus the new element's frequency. Expand or shrink to maintain feasibility."
"1926","Nearest Exit from Entrance in Maze","BFS from the entrance","Traverse in all directions, track steps. If we reach a boundary cell that isn’t the entrance, return steps."
"516","Longest Palindromic Subsequence","DP with two indices","If s[i]==s[j], dp[i][j]=2+dp[i+1][j-1]. Else max of dp[i+1][j], dp[i][j-1]."
"1726","Tuple with Same Product","Hash product -> list of pairs","For each pair, compute product. If product repeats, update count for combinations."
"213","House Robber II","DP on circular array","Compute best for [0..n-2] and [1..n-1]. Return the max, because you can’t rob house 0 and n-1 together."
"981","Time Based Key-Value Store","Map of key -> list of (timestamp, value)","For get(key, timestamp), binary search the list of pairs for the largest timestamp ≤ request."
"1248","Count Number of Nice Subarrays","Sliding window counting odd numbers","Expand window tracking how many odd numbers inside. If exactly k, move left pointer to find all sub-variations."
"2342","Max Sum of a Pair With Equal Sum of Digits","Map digit_sum -> top two values","For each number, sum its digits. Track top two in that bucket, update global max of their sum."
"1008","Construct Binary Search Tree from Preorder Traversal","Recursively with boundaries or stack","Root = first element, next smaller go left, bigger go right. Or use a stack approach for building BST."
"364","Nested List Weight Sum II","Reverse depth weighting","First find max depth, then weight values by (maxDepth - currentDepth + 1). Sum up."
"3066","Minimum Operations to Exceed Threshold Value II","(Problem-specific) Possibly BFS or DP","We want to exceed a threshold with minimal steps. Use known increments or factor steps as given."
"602","Friend Requests II: Who Has the Most Friends","SQL grouping or join","Count friend relationships, group by user, pick user with max. Possibly subselect or rank."
"1352","Product of the Last K Numbers","Keep prefix product, handle zeros","Maintain an array of prefix products. If zero occurs, reset. For getProduct(k), divide prefix accordingly."
"1254","Number of Closed Islands","DFS from boundary to mark open water","First mark all reachable '0' from edges. Then count islands fully enclosed by '1'."
"1079","Letter Tile Possibilities","Backtracking with frequency map","Generate all permutations of the multiset of letters. Count distinct results."
"277","Find the Celebrity","Elimination then verify","If a knows b, a can't be celebrity. Narrow down to one candidate, confirm by checks."
"1415","The k-th Lexicographical String of All Happy Strings of Length n","Backtracking or BFS in lex order","Build strings from 'abc', disallow consecutive duplicates. Then pick k-th in sorted order."
"304","Range Sum Query 2D - Immutable","2D prefix sum","Build sums[x][y] of rectangle (0,0 to x,y). Answer queries in O(1) using prefix sum differences."
"311","Sparse Matrix Multiplication","Only multiply non-zero elements","For each non-zero in A’s row, multiply by non-zero in B’s col. Sum partial products."
"650","2 Keys Keyboard","DP or BFS for minimal steps","Operations are copyAll and paste. Minim steps often relate to factor decomposition of n."
"95","Unique Binary Search Trees II","Recursive generation of BSTs","For each i in [1..n], i is root, recursively generate left subtree (1..i-1) and right (i+1..n)."
"886","Possible Bipartition","Graph 2-coloring","Build adjacency from the dislike pairs, try coloring with two colors. If conflict, return false."
"487","Max Consecutive Ones II","Sliding window allowing one zero flip","Expand window, if more than one zero, shrink from left. Keep track of the longest window."
"2467","Most Profitable Path in a Tree","Tree DFS with path constraints (partial known)","Likely track distances or father/son relationships. Possibly a DP on tree edges to maximize profit."
"221","Maximal Square","DP tracking squares","dp[i][j] = 1 + min(top, left, diagonal) if cell is '1'. Track max side found."
"740","Delete and Earn","Transform to house-robber on freq array","For each number, you either “take” it (and skip adjacent) or skip it. Summation of freq * number."
"621","Task Scheduler","Greedy scheduling based on most frequent tasks","Let max frequency = f. Place them in a timeline with intervals. Fill idle slots with other tasks."
"974","Subarray Sums Divisible by K","Prefix sum mod technique","Compute prefixSum%k, store counts in a map. If sum%k reappears, those segments form divisible subarray."
"3371","Identify the Largest Outlier in an Array","(Problem-specific) Possibly check deviation from mean","Compute mean or median, find data point with largest difference. Return that outlier."
"1524","Number of Sub-arrays With Odd Sum","Prefix sum parity counting","Track how many even/odd prefix sums so far. The pair (odd,even) or (even,odd) leads to odd subarray sum."
"204","Count Primes","Sieve of Eratosthenes","Mark multiples of each prime up to sqrt(n). Count how many remain unmarked as prime."
"59","Spiral Matrix II","Generate n×n spiral with 1..n*n","Layer by layer, fill top row left->right, right column top->down, bottom row right->left, etc."
"2579","Count Total Number of Colored Cells","(Problem statement) Possibly direct formula for pattern","Analyze pattern of growth each step. Derive formula for total colored after n moves."
"2523","Closest Prime Numbers in Range","Sieve then linear scan for minimal gap","Generate primes up to right. Walk through primes in [left..right], track smallest difference."
"763","Partition Labels","Greedy using last occurrences","Track last occurrence of each character. Partition string so that each block doesn’t share characters outside."

Each row gives:

  • number: the LeetCode problem ID

  • name: the official title

  • concept: the high-level idea (data structure/algorithm/technique)

  • how_to_solve: a quick 1–3 sentence approach

You can use this CSV to see which core ideas appear repeatedly (e.g. “sliding window,” “DFS on grid,” “prefix sums,” “backtracking,” etc.) and build a structured study path from simpler to more advanced concepts.

User:
You said:
Ok not quite look at the third column and find granular pieces of understanding that is required to intuitively understand the problem, replace such pieces of understanding into a single word if the understanding is multiword example "sliding window" will become "sliding_window" Go you got this ! "2","Add Two Numbers","LinkedList addition, carry","Add digits node by node with carry, build a new result list. Keep track of carry for any leftover." "3","Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters","Sliding window, hashing","Use two pointers and a set/map to track used chars. Move the start pointer when a char repeats, and record the max length." "5","Longest Palindromic Substring","Expand around center / DP","For each center (character or gap), expand outwards to find palindromes. Keep track of the max length found." "7","Reverse Integer","Math manipulations, handle overflow","Reverse digits by mod/div operations and build the result. Watch for overflow bounds." "8","String to Integer (atoi)","String parsing, edge cases","Strip spaces, handle sign, parse digits until non-digit. Clamp to integer bounds if overflow occurs." "11","Container With Most Water","Two-pointer approach","Start with left=0, right=n-1, compute area. Move the pointer with the smaller height inward, tracking max area." "15","3Sum","Sorting + two-pointer","Sort the array, fix one number, then use two-pointer on the remainder. Skip duplicates and record valid triplets." "16","3Sum Closest","Sorting + two-pointer","Sort, then fix one number and use two-pointer to find the best sum close to target. Track minimum difference." "17","Letter Combinations of a Phone Number","Backtracking, phone keypad mapping","Map each digit to letters, then recursively build possible strings. Collect all valid letter combinations." "18","4Sum","Sorting, two-pointer","Sort the array, fix two numbers, then two-pointer the remaining part. Carefully skip duplicates." "19","Remove Nth Node From End of List","Linked list, fast/slow pointer","Move fast pointer n steps, then move both until fast hits null. Remove the slow pointer’s next node." "22","Generate Parentheses","Backtracking with constraints","Recursively build parentheses strings, tracking count of '(' and ')'. Only add '(' if available, ')' if it won’t break validity." "24","Swap Nodes in Pairs","Linked list node swaps","Swap every two adjacent nodes in the list. Update pointers carefully to maintain the linkage." "29","Divide Two Integers","Math, bit manipulation","Simulate division by repeated subtraction or shifting. Handle overflow and sign properly." "31","Next Permutation","Permutation rearrangement","From the end, find first decreasing pair. Swap with next larger element and reverse the suffix." "33","Search in Rotated Sorted Array","Binary search variant","Identify which half is sorted based on mid vs boundaries. Narrow the search range accordingly." "34","Find First and Last Position of Element in Sorted Array","Binary search boundaries","Use binary search to find the leftmost occurrence, then another to find the rightmost. Return [-1,-1] if not found." "36","Valid Sudoku","Hash sets for row/col/box","For each row, column, and sub-box, ensure no duplicate digits. Use sets or direct boolean checks." "38","Count and Say","String generation pattern","Iteratively build the next sequence by describing the previous term’s consecutive digits." "40","Combination Sum II","Backtracking with sorted input","Sort, then backtrack while skipping duplicates. Only take each candidate once at a given level." "43","Multiply Strings","String multiplication simulation","Multiply each digit of one string by each digit of the other, summing partial products. Handle carry and leading zeros." "46","Permutations","Backtracking or swapping","Recursively choose each element as the first, swap, and generate permutations of the remainder." "48","Rotate Image","Matrix transpose + reverse","Transpose the matrix, then reverse each row. That results in a 90-degree rotation in-place." "49","Group Anagrams","Hashing by sorted key or char count","Sort each string or build a frequency key, store in a map from key to group of anagrams." "50","Pow(x, n)","Fast exponentiation","Recursively divide n by 2, square the result. Handle odd exponents separately." "53","Maximum Subarray","Kadane’s algorithm","Iterate while keeping track of the current sum, reset if it goes below zero. Maintain max sum encountered." "54","Spiral Matrix","Simulation of boundary loops","Peel the matrix layer by layer in a spiral. Update boundaries (top/bottom/left/right) after each loop." "55","Jump Game","Greedy max reach","Track the furthest index reachable. If you ever can’t advance to the next index, return false." "56","Merge Intervals","Sorting and merging","Sort intervals by start. Merge overlapping intervals by taking the max end." "57","Insert Interval","Intervals + merging","Locate insertion point, merge overlapping intervals, then insert the final merged result." "62","Unique Paths","Combinatorics or DP","Either use the binomial formula (choose steps) or a DP grid counting ways to reach each cell." "63","Unique Paths II","DP with obstacle handling","Same DP approach, but set dp cell to 0 if obstacle is there. Accumulate paths otherwise." "71","Simplify Path","Stack for directories","Split the path on '/', push non-'..' to stack, pop on '..', skip '.' or empty segments. Join stack to form final path." "72","Edit Distance","DP for string transformations","dp[i][j] = 1 + min of replace/delete/insert, or dp[i-1][j-1] if chars match. Fill up the table." "73","Set Matrix Zeroes","Matrix marking approach","Track which rows/cols should be zero using extra structures or first row/col. Zero them in a second pass." "75","Sort Colors","Dutch National Flag algorithm","Use three pointers for 0, 1, 2. Swap to place 0s in front, 2s at end." "78","Subsets","Backtracking or bitmask","Generate all subsets via recursion or bitwise enumeration. Collect them in a result list." "79","Word Search","DFS backtracking on board","For each cell, DFS to match the word. Mark visited to avoid reusing the same cell." "80","Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array II","Array manipulation, pointer approach","Allow each element up to two occurrences. Overwrite beyond that limit in-place." "74","Search a 2D Matrix","Binary search","Either flatten conceptually and do 1D binary search, or do row-col approach. Compare mid value with target." "93","Restore IP Addresses","Backtracking + segment validation","Partition string into 4 segments, each 0-255. If used all digits correctly, record the result." "98","Validate Binary Search Tree","Recursion with range bounds","Check each node’s value is within min/max, recurse left/right. Return false if out of bounds." "102","Binary Tree Level Order Traversal","BFS by levels","Queue the root, pop level nodes, push children. Collect levels in a list of lists." "103","Binary Tree Zigzag Level Order Traversal","BFS with direction toggle","Same as level order, but reverse the list on alternate levels." "105","Construct Binary Tree from Preorder and Inorder Traversal","Tree construction with index lookups","Preorder[0] is root, find it in inorder. Recursively build left subtree and right subtree." "113","Path Sum II","DFS path building","Track running sum down each path. If leaf sum equals target, add path to result." "114","Flatten Binary Tree to Linked List","DFS, pointer re-linking","Flatten left subtree, attach it between node and right subtree. Re-link and continue recursively." "116","Populating Next Right Pointers in Each Node","Tree BFS or perfect tree recursion","Use level order or connect children as you go. Each node’s next = node’s right sibling in BFS." "128","Longest Consecutive Sequence","Set or union-find","Insert all numbers in a set, for each number check consecutive neighbors. Track the longest streak." "129","Sum Root to Leaf Numbers","DFS building integer","Pass the current value*10 + node.val down. Sum at leaves." "131","Palindrome Partitioning","Backtracking + palindrome check","Partition string and check each substring is palindrome. Collect all valid ways." "133","Clone Graph","Graph BFS/DFS cloning","Keep a map old->new node. Traverse, creating cloned neighbors recursively or iteratively." "138","Copy List with Random Pointer","Linked list mapping or weaving","Either store old->new in a hash map, or weave cloned nodes in the original, then fix random links." "139","Word Break","DP substring checks","dp[i] is true if substring(0..i) can be broken into dictionary words. Check all j < i for substring in set." "146","LRU Cache","Design with doubly linked list + hash","Use a hash map for O(1) access. A linked list tracks recency, moving recently accessed to the front." "150","Evaluate Reverse Polish Notation","Stack for RPN","Iterate tokens, push numbers, pop top two on operator, compute, push result. Return final stack top." "152","Maximum Product Subarray","DP tracking min/max up to current","Negative flips min and max. Keep track of global maximum." "153","Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array","Binary search pivot","Compare mid to edges. Narrow down to the segment where min lies." "151","Reverse Words in a String","String manipulation","Split by spaces, reverse the words, and rejoin. Trim extra spaces." "162","Find Peak Element","Binary search or linear check","In O(log n), compare mid with mid+1 to decide which half to search. Or linearly check neighbors." "167","Two Sum II - Input Array Is Sorted","Two-pointer in sorted array","Start left=0, right=n-1, compare sum to target, adjust pointers inward." "173","Binary Search Tree Iterator","Inorder stack approach","Push left nodes, pop top as next. After pop, push the node’s right subtree left path." "189","Rotate Array","Reverse array or use auxiliary array","Reverse entire array, then reverse the two parts. Or shift elements using temp array." "198","House Robber","DP on linear houses","dp[i] = max of dp[i-1] or nums[i] + dp[i-2]. Final dp[n-1] is the answer." "199","Binary Tree Right Side View","BFS or DFS with right-first","At each level, record the rightmost node. Or do a DFS with level track and store first visit." "200","Number of Islands","DFS/BFS on grid","Traverse the grid, for each unvisited land, run DFS/BFS to mark the connected region, increment count." "207","Course Schedule","Graph cycle detection / topological sort","Create adjacency list. If there's a cycle, no solution. Otherwise, can finish courses." "209","Minimum Size Subarray Sum","Sliding window for subarray sum","Move end pointer, accumulate sum, shrink from start if sum >= target. Track min length." "210","Course Schedule II","Topological sort","Use Kahn’s or DFS to produce a valid course order. If cycle, return empty array." "215","Kth Largest Element in an Array","Heap or quickselect","Use a min-heap of size k or partition approach. Return the k-th largest after partial sort." "227","Basic Calculator II","Stack or direct parse","Parse expression tokens. Use stack to store numbers, handle * / immediately. Compute + - at the end." "235","Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Search Tree","BST property: compare values","Traverse from root. If both nodes < root, go left; if both > root, go right; else root is LCA." "236","Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree","Tree recursion","Recurse down; if we find p or q, bubble up. If both sides non-null, current node is LCA." "238","Product of Array Except Self","Prefix/suffix multiplication","Compute prefix products, then multiply with suffix product in second pass. O(1) extra space aside from output." "249","Group Shifted Strings","Hash pattern differences","For each string, build a relative shift signature. Group strings with identical shift signatures." "253","Meeting Rooms II","Min-heap or timeline approach","Sort intervals by start, use a min-heap to track end times. Or separate start/end arrays and track usage." "286","Walls and Gates","Multi-source BFS","Put all gates (distance=0) in queue initially. BFS outward to fill distances to the nearest gate." "2265","Count Nodes Equal to Average of Subtree","Tree DFS for sum & count","Compute subtree sum and count. If node’s val == (sum/count), increment result." "314","Binary Tree Vertical Order Traversal","BFS with column indices","Use a queue storing (node, col). Collect values in a map col->list, then output col-sorted lists." "333","Largest BST Subtree","Tree recursion with subtree info","Return subtree size, min, max, isBST. If node is BST, update global max size." "334","Increasing Triplet Subsequence","Greedy track two smallest","Maintain two pointers for smallest and mid. If we find a bigger number than mid, triplet exists." "339","Nested List Weight Sum","DFS or BFS of nested structure","At each level, multiply integer by depth. Recursively add or BFS with a queue tracking depth." "341","Flatten Nested List Iterator","Stack-based flatten","Repeatedly expand top if it's a list. If it's an integer, that's our next element." "347","Top K Frequent Elements","Heap or bucket sort","Count frequencies, push to a min-heap or use bucket by frequency. Extract top K frequent." "348","Design Tic-Tac-Toe","Rows, cols, diag counters","For each player, increment row/col/diag counts. If absolute value hits n, that player wins." "378","Kth Smallest Element in a Sorted Matrix","Heap or binary searching by value","Use a min-heap or binary search in the value range. Count how many elements <= mid to narrow search." "380","Insert Delete GetRandom O(1)","HashMap + dynamic array","For O(1) insert/delete, store values in an array and map their index. For random, pick a random array index." "394","Decode String","Stack or recursion","Push current string and number on stack when encountering '['. On ']', pop and build repeated substring." "398","Random Pick Index","Reservoir sampling or storing indices","Maintain a list of indices per value, then pick random. Or do reservoir sampling as you traverse." "419","Battleships in a Board","Grid scanning","Count a battleship when you see 'X' that isn’t a continuation (above/left). Mark visited or just check adjacency." "424","Longest Repeating Character Replacement","Sliding window + frequency","Grow the window, track count of most frequent char. If window size - max_freq > k, shrink from left." "443","String Compression","Two-pointer in-place","Track runs of the same character. Store the count digits and move on, returning final length." "468","Validate IP Address","String split and format checks","Split by '.' or ':', check valid range or hex length. Distinguish IPv4, IPv6, or neither." "490","The Maze","DFS/BFS rolling approach","Roll the ball in each direction until hitting a wall. Mark visited states, check if you can reach the goal." "494","Target Sum","DFS or subset-sum DP","We want ways to assign +/- to reach target. Transform to subset sum or backtrack all possibilities." "498","Diagonal Traverse","Simulation of diagonals","Traverse diagonals by sum of indices. Reverse direction every alternate diagonal." "523","Continuous Subarray Sum","Prefix sum mod k","Compute prefix sum % k, store in a map. If the same mod reappears with distance > 1, subarray sum is multiple of k." "525","Contiguous Array","Prefix sum (0 -> -1, 1 -> +1)","Map prefix sums to index. If sum repeats, subarray in between has equal 0 and 1." "529","Minesweeper","DFS/BFS reveal squares","If a revealed cell has 0 adjacent mines, recursively reveal its neighbors. Stop if you hit a mine or no expansions left." "536","Construct Binary Tree from String","Recursion with parentheses parse","Parse the string: first number is root, parentheses sections represent left/right subtrees." "545","Boundary of Binary Tree","Tree traversal boundary","Collect left boundary, leaves, and right boundary in reverse. Avoid double counting corners." "556","Next Greater Element III","Permutation next greater logic","Treat digits like next permutation. If not possible, return -1." "560","Subarray Sum Equals K","Prefix sum + hashing","Keep running sum in a map. If sum - k exists, increment count by how many times that remainder appeared." "636","Exclusive Time of Functions","Stack of function calls + timestamps","Push function id on 'start', pop on 'end', accumulate intervals. Subtract nested intervals from parent." "647","Palindromic Substrings","Expand around center or DP","For each center, expand outwards while it’s a palindrome. Count all valid centers." "658","Find K Closest Elements","Binary search or two-pointer","Locate position of x, then expand outwards or do a binary search for the left boundary of size k. Return slice." "670","Maximum Swap","Greedy digit swap from left","Scan from left, find a bigger digit on the right that can be swapped. Perform once for max number." "695","Max Area of Island","DFS/BFS in grid","For each unvisited '1', explore the entire connected region. Track the maximum area found." "721","Accounts Merge","Union-Find or DFS on email lists","Merge accounts with shared emails. Sort final results by name/email." "735","Asteroid Collision","Stack approach","Push new asteroid. If collision occurs with top of stack, pop smaller or break if stack top is bigger." "739","Daily Temperatures","Monotonic stack","Traverse from right or maintain a stack of indices. Pop while top is cooler, the difference is the answer." "426","Convert Binary Search Tree to Sorted Doubly Linked List","Inorder traversal link","Perform an inorder DFS, link previous node to current. Finally link head and tail to make it circular." "787","Cheapest Flights Within K Stops","Shortest path with limited stops (Bellman-Ford or BFS)","Track cost to each node up to K edges. Update in a BFS/relaxation manner." "791","Custom Sort String","Custom priority sort","Store order in a dict of char->rank. Sort the input string’s characters by that rank, append leftover." "708","Insert into a Sorted Circular Linked List","Linked list insertion logic","Traverse until insertion point or wrap around. Insert new node maintaining sorted order." "825","Friends Of Appropriate Ages","Sorting & two-pointer on age constraints","Sort ages, for each age find valid range. Use prefix sums or pointers to skip invalid combos." "622","Design Circular Queue","Array with front/rear indices","Implement a fixed-size array queue that wraps around. Track count, front, and rear positions." "852","Peak Index in a Mountain Array","Binary search for peak","Compare mid with mid+1. If ascending, move right; else move left until peak found." "863","All Nodes Distance K in Binary Tree","BFS/DFS from target node","First store parent references, then BFS from target node to find nodes at distance K." "865","Smallest Subtree with all the Deepest Nodes","Tree DFS, depth tracking","Identify deepest level, find the subtree containing all deepest nodes. Essentially LCA of deepest leaves." "528","Random Pick with Weight","Prefix sums + random selection","Compute prefix sums of weights, pick a random in [0,total). Binary search for the segment." "921","Minimum Add to Make Parentheses Valid","Balance counters","Track needed '(' or ')'. Each time there's an unmatched ')', increment needed. Return total needed." "930","Binary Subarrays With Sum","Prefix sum in 0/1 array","Similar to subarray-sum equals K. Map prefix sums, subarray if current_sum - target in map." "934","Shortest Bridge","DFS + BFS across islands","Find the first island via DFS, add it to a queue, BFS outward to reach second island in min steps." "958","Check Completeness of a Binary Tree","BFS level order checking","Traverse level by level, once a null is found, ensure no more non-null nodes appear." "973","K Closest Points to Origin","Heap or quickselect","Compute distance squared, keep a max-heap of size k or do partition-based quickselect." "983","Minimum Cost For Tickets","DP with intervals","For each travel day, cost = min of day pass, 7-day pass, 30-day pass. Build DP up to last day." "986","Interval List Intersections","Merge intervals method","Use two pointers on the two lists, intersect the overlapping intervals, advance pointer that ends first." "1004","Max Consecutive Ones III","Sliding window, count zero","Expand window. If zero count exceeds k, shrink from left. Track max window size." "1011","Capacity To Ship Packages Within D Days","Binary search on capacity","Check if a mid capacity can ship within D days. If not, increase capacity, else lower it." "1060","Missing Element in Sorted Array","Binary search using the missing counts","At index i, how many are missing up to nums[i]? If < k, go right; else go left." "1091","Shortest Path in Binary Matrix","BFS in 8 directions","Start from (0,0) if not blocked, BFS for the shortest path to (n-1,n-1). Track visited cells." "1209","Remove All Adjacent Duplicates in String II","Stack-based count","Push characters and track frequency. If the frequency hits k, pop them." "1249","Minimum Remove to Make Valid Parentheses","Stack or scanning mismatches","Push '(' indices, match with ')' or mark invalid ones. Remove unmatched parentheses in the end." "1424","Diagonal Traverse II","Group by i+j in a map","Traverse row-wise, append to map keyed by (i+j). Flatten in the correct order." "1443","Minimum Time to Collect All Apples in a Tree","DFS subtrees with apple-check","From root, visit children. Include path cost if a child subtree contains an apple." "1570","Dot Product of Two Sparse Vectors","Sparse representation iteration","Store non-zero indices and values. Multiply only indices in common." "1650","Lowest Common Ancestor of a Binary Tree III","Nodes have parent pointers","Ascend from each node or equalize depths first. Move both up until they meet." "1762","Buildings With an Ocean View","Stack or scanning from the right","Traverse from right, track max height. Buildings taller than all to the right have a view." "1778","Shortest Path in a Hidden Grid","Interactive BFS/DFS concept","We do BFS steps, learning adjacency dynamically. Keep track of visited to find minimal route." "1868","Product of Two Run-Length Encoded Arrays","Two pointers on runs","Multiply each run chunk while adjusting counts. Output in RLE form." "1070","Product Sales Analysis III","SQL grouping and joining","Combine tables to get total product sales. GROUP BY product, possibly with subqueries or joins." "322","Coin Change","DP for the fewest coins","dp[x] = min(dp[x], dp[x-coin] + 1). Initialize dp[0]=0, otherwise large. If dp[amount] not updated, return -1." "328","Odd Even Linked List","Linked list rearrangement","Put odd indices first, even indices next. Update pointers so that all odds connect, then all evens." "912","Sort an Array","Implementation of standard sorts","Use quicksort, mergesort, or heapsort. Return the sorted array." "1344","Angle Between Hands of a Clock","Math formula","Compute minute hand angle and hour hand angle. Return the absolute difference, mod 360 if needed." "91","Decode Ways","DP on string decoding","dp[i] can come from single digit or two-digit decode if valid. Summation yields total ways." "117","Populating Next Right Pointers in Each Node II","Level order BFS linking","Traverse level by level, link nodes horizontally. Keep track of next level head and tail." "161","One Edit Distance","Check single insert/delete/replace","If lengths differ, see if one insert can fix. If same length, check if only one replace is needed." "1586","Binary Search Tree Iterator II","BST iteration with backtracking","Like BST Iterator but we store visited nodes to allow backward iteration as well." "1123","Lowest Common Ancestor of Deepest Leaves","DFS depth + LCA logic","Find max depth, then LCA of all deepest. Recurse subtrees to see if children contain deepest leaves." "325","Maximum Size Subarray Sum Equals k","Prefix sum map","Track running sum. If sum-k in map, check index difference for max length." "377","Combination Sum IV","DP counting combos","dp[target] += dp[target - num] if target >= num. Order matters if we iterate over nums first." "1810","Minimum Path Cost in a Hidden Grid","Similar BFS with hidden adjacency","We query cost of edges on the fly, track minimal path in BFS. Keep visited states or cost." "237","Delete Node in a Linked List","In-place pointer swap","Copy data from next node into current, then skip the next node. This effectively removes current." "143","Reorder List","Linked list re-linking","Find midpoint, reverse second half, then interleave it with the first half." "82","Remove Duplicates from Sorted List II","Linked list skip duplicates","Use dummy head, skip over nodes that appear more than once. Link only distinct nodes." "179","Largest Number","Custom sorting by string comparison","Sort numbers by comparing xy vs yx (string concat). Join them afterward."
