"45","Jump Game II","Greedy BFS layering","Track current reach and next reach. When current index surpasses the current reach, increment jumps." "450","Delete Node in a BST","BST node manipulation","Find the node. If two children, swap with successor or predecessor. Then remove leaf or single-child node." "134","Gas Station","Greedy solution","If total gas < total cost, no solution. Otherwise, track deficits and pick the start index after them." "1609","Even Odd Tree","Tree BFS + constraints","For each level, nodes must be strictly increasing/decreasing and follow even/odd pattern. Validate or fail." "875","Koko Eating Bananas","Binary search on eating speed","Check if a mid speed can eat all bananas in H hours. Adjust boundaries accordingly." "230","Kth Smallest Element in a BST","Inorder traversal","Traverse in sorted order. The kth visited node is the kth smallest." "1371","Find the Longest Substring Containing Vowels in Even Counts","Bitmask prefix approach","Track parity of each vowel in an integer mask. If mask repeats, substring between them has even counts." "2419","Longest Subarray With Maximum Bitwise AND","Scan for segments matching global max","First find the maximum value in array. Then find the longest consecutive segment of that value." "539","Minimum Time Difference","Convert times to minutes, sort","Check adjacent differences, also consider wrap-around from end to start. Return min difference." "567","Permutation in String","Sliding window + frequency","Keep a frequency count of s1. Slide over s2 with window size |s1|. If freq matches, return true." "416","Partition Equal Subset Sum","DP subset sum","If total sum is odd, no. Otherwise, check if we can form sum/2 using subset-sum DP." "122","Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II","Greedy for multiple transactions","Sum all positive differences between consecutive days. This captures the max profit from unlimited transactions." "386","Lexicographical Numbers","DFS or iterative approach","Generate from 1...n in lex order by branching *10. Or transform numbers to strings and sort them." "340","Longest Substring with At Most K Distinct Characters","Sliding window with char count","Expand window, track distinct count. If > k, shrink from left. Track max length." "3043","Find the Length of the Longest Common Prefix","Simple prefix check among strings","Compare characters across all strings until mismatch. Return length of matched prefix." "81","Search in Rotated Sorted Array II","Binary search with duplicates","Similar to #33 but if nums[mid]==nums[left], move left++. Otherwise do the usual pivot logic." "1367","Linked List in Binary Tree","DFS checking subpath","For each tree node, see if it matches the head of list. Recursively match subsequent list nodes." "767","Reorganize String","Greedy with a max heap or sorting by freq","If any char’s freq > half the string length (rounded up), impossible. Otherwise alternate the most frequent chars." "371","Sum of Two Integers","Bitwise ops","Use XOR for sum, AND << 1 for carry. Repeat until carry is zero." "1590","Make Sum Divisible by P","Prefix sum remainder approach","Find total sum%p=remain. We want subarray whose sum%p=remain to remove. Track prefix remainders in a map." "96","Unique Binary Search Trees","Catalan number / DP","Number of BSTs for n is the nth Catalan. Or use DP: G(n)=Σ(G(i-1)*G(n-i))." "12","Integer to Roman","Greedy from largest roman values","Keep subtracting the largest possible symbol value, append the symbol. Continue until zero." "2090","K Radius Subarray Averages","Sliding window or prefix sums","For each i, the average is sum over [i-k..i+k]. Validate boundaries and compute quickly with prefix sums." "287","Find the Duplicate Number","Floyd’s cycle detection or binary search","Use slow/fast pointer to detect cycle, then locate entry. Or binary search count of <= mid to find duplicate." "453","Minimum Moves to Equal Array Elements","Sum approach minus min","Each move increments n-1 elements. Equivalent to sum(array) - min(array)*n." "1593","Split a String Into the Max Number of Unique Substrings","Backtracking with used-set","Try all substr splits. If not used, pick it and recurse to find maximum partitions." "1438","Longest Continuous Subarray With Absolute Diff ≤ Limit","Sliding window + min/max queue","Keep track of window’s min and max in O(1). If the diff is too big, shrink from the left." "1891","Cutting Ribbons","Binary search for max length","Check if mid is feasible by counting how many pieces we get. If enough, go bigger, else smaller." "229","Majority Element II","Boyer-Moore for two candidates","We can have up to 2 majority elements > n/3. Find potential candidates then verify them." Count subsets using powers of 2 mod." "137","Single Number II","Bit manipulation counting bits mod 3","Sum bits in each position mod 3. The remainder forms the unique number." "1493","Longest Subarray of 1's After Deleting One Element","Sliding window tracking zero count","Expand window, if more than one zero, shrink from left. Track max length of 1s." "510","Inorder Successor in BST II","BST with parent pointer","If node has right subtree, go left from right child. Otherwise, ascend parent until child is a left branch." "856","Score of Parentheses","Stack or counting depth","Push '(' onto stack, on ')' compute 1 if it was "()". Otherwise 2 * stack top if nested." "1161","Maximum Level Sum of a Binary Tree","BFS level sums","Compute sum for each level, track which level has the max sum." "77","Combinations","Backtracking k-combinations","Choose elements from 1..n with recursion. Collect all combinations of length k." "907","Sum of Subarray Minimums","Monotonic stack to find each element's subarray coverage","For each element, find how far left/right it remains the min. Accumulate contribution." "692","Top K Frequent Words","Frequency + min-heap or sorting","Count freq, use a min-heap of size k or sort by freq desc then lexicographical ascending." "918","Maximum Sum Circular Subarray","Kadane’s or invert approach","Compute normal max subarray. Then find min subarray and subtract from total if not all negative." "678","Valid Parenthesis String","Greedy track min/max open","For '(' => min++, max++. For ')' => min--, max-- but min≥0 => set to 0 if negative. If max<0, invalid." "417","Pacific Atlantic Water Flow","DFS from edges inward","Start from each ocean boundary, mark reachable. Intersection of reachable from both is the result." "176","Second Highest Salary","SQL ranking or subquery","SELECT max(Salary) where Salary < (SELECT max(Salary)) from Employee. Or use limit offset in some dialect." "247","Strobogrammatic Number II","Recursion building symmetrical pairs","Place pairs (1,1), (6,9), (8,8), (9,6), (0,0). Middle can be (0,1,8) if length odd." "1358","Number of Substrings Containing All Three Characters","Sliding window for 'a','b','c'","Expand window until all three present, then shrink from left while valid. Count the new valid substrings." "2109","Adding Spaces to a String","String building with known indices","Track the positions where spaces go. Reconstruct the result by inserting spaces at those indices." "1029","Two City Scheduling","Greedy sorting by cost difference","Sort persons by difference in flying cost (A - B). Send the first half to one city, the rest to the other." "1245","Tree Diameter","Double DFS approach","Pick any node, DFS to find the farthest node. From that node, DFS again to find the farthest distance. That distance is the diameter." "1679","Max Number of K-Sum Pairs","Sorting + two-pointer or map freq","Sort and use left/right pointers. If sum < k, move left; if sum>k, move right; else count pair and move both." "2337","Move Pieces to Obtain a String","Greedy alignment check of 'L'/'R'","Positions of 'L' can’t move right, positions of 'R' can’t move left. Check if transformation is feasible in order." "388","Longest Absolute File Path","Stack or counting depth from '\t'","Split input by lines, track current path length in a stack. Update max length for files." "395","Longest Substring with At Least K Repeating Characters","Divide and conquer or sliding window","If a char's freq < k, split around it. Otherwise entire substring is valid." "2981","Find Longest Special Substring That Occurs Thrice I","String hashing / suffix array approach","Likely do a binary search on substring length, check if it appears 3 times via hash or suffix structure." "382","Linked List Random Node","Reservoir sampling for single item","Traverse nodes, replace the chosen node with probability 1/i. Return final choice." "2593","Find Score of an Array After Marking All Elements","Greedy or DP approach (problem-specific)","Pick smallest unmarked, add to score, mark neighbors. Possibly a sorted approach." "2125","Number of Laser Beams in a Bank","Multiply device counts in consecutive non-empty rows","For each row, count '1's. Multiply consecutive row device counts to add to total." "1277","Count Square Submatrices with All Ones","DP counting squares","dp[i][j] = 1 + min of neighbors if cell==1. Sum dp values for total squares." "1094","Car Pooling","Prefix difference or min-heap","Record passenger changes at start/end, accumulate. Check if capacity exceeded at any point." "503","Next Greater Element II","Monotonic stack, circular array","Traverse array twice (mod index). Pop smaller elements to find next greater for each index." "729","My Calendar I","Interval booking check","Keep a data structure of intervals. Before adding, check if it overlaps with existing. Return true if success." "2352","Equal Row and Column Pairs","Compare row patterns with column patterns","Build row strings in a map. For each column, build a string, see how many row matches exist." "515","Find Largest Value in Each Tree Row","BFS track max in each level","For each level, track the maximum node value. Append to result." "1980","Find Unique Binary String","Diagonal or backtracking approach","Take the i-th bit from i-th string and flip it to ensure uniqueness. This 'diagonal flip' guarantees difference." "1014","Best Sightseeing Pair","DP track best (A[i]+i) while scanning","We want max of A[i]+A[j]+(i-j). Keep a running best of A[i]+i, update result with that plus A[j]-j." "155","Min Stack","Stack with a min tracker","Push normal stack and track current min in parallel. On pop, restore the min from the secondary structure." "2466","Count Ways To Build Good Strings","DP with steps or zero/one increments","dp[i] can be built from dp[i-zero] + dp[i-one]. Possibly handle mod." "1055","Shortest Way to Form String","Greedy scanning of S to build T","Repeatedly match a subsequence of S to a chunk of T until T is fully formed. Count how many subsequences used." "310","Minimum Height Trees","BFS from leaves inward","Peel off leaf nodes level by level. The final remaining one(s) form the tree's MHT root(s)." "542","01 Matrix","Multi-source BFS from all zero cells","Put all zero positions in queue, BFS outward, each step’s distance is 1 more than predecessor." "2270","Number of Ways to Split Array","Prefix sums vs suffix sums","We want splits where prefix >= suffix. For index i, check if sum(0..i) >= sum(i+1..end). Count valid i." "1930","Unique Length-3 Palindromic Subsequences","Track positions of each character","For each char as outer pair, count distinct different middle chars. Tally total unique triplets." "438","Find All Anagrams in a String","Sliding window freq compare","Keep freq of chars in 'p'. Slide a window of size len(p) over 's', check if frequencies match." "2381","Shifting Letters II","Prefix approach on shift ranges","For each [start,end,direction], track shift in prefix array. Apply cumulative shifts to build final string." "130","Surrounded Regions","DFS/BFS from board edges","Mark 'O' connected to edges as safe. Flip the unmarked 'O's to 'X', revert marked to 'O'." "1769","Minimum Number of Operations to Move All Balls to Each Box","Prefix sums or counting distances","We can sum distance to each box. Two passes or prefix sums help compute in O(n)." "547","Number of Provinces","Union-Find or DFS adjacency","If matrix[i][j]==1, union sets i and j. Count distinct connected components in the end." "393","UTF-8 Validation","Check leading bits of each byte","Check how many leading 1 bits for the first byte, then verify subsequent bytes start with '10'." "402","Remove K Digits","Monotonic stack to keep smaller digits","Pop while top is larger than the current digit and k>0. If leftover k remains, remove from end." "916","Word Subsets","Frequency requirement across B","Compute the max freq needed for each letter from B. Check each A to ensure it meets or exceeds that freq." "1400","Construct K Palindrome Strings","Check number of odd freq chars","If # of odd freq characters > k, impossible. Otherwise we can rearrange to form k palindrome strings." "2116","Check if a Parentheses String Can Be Valid","Greedy or partial lock approach","We have locked parentheses. Possibly track min/max open, flipping where possible if not locked." "1062","Longest Repeating Substring","Binary search + rolling hash or suffix structures","Try mid length, see if substring repeats. If yes, go bigger, else smaller." "2348","Number of Zero-Filled Subarrays","Count consecutive zero segments","If you have a run of length L zeroes, it contributes L*(L+1)/2 subarrays." "2657","Find the Prefix Common Array of Two Arrays","Set-based or index-based counting","At each prefix i, count how many elements appear in both arrays up to i. Possibly keep sets or freq." "2013","Detect Squares","Hash points by x or y","For each new point, check potential square corners. Maintain freq of points in a data structure." "2326","Spiral Matrix IV","Spiral fill with linked list","Traverse matrix in spiral order, placing linked list values. Once done or list empty, stop." "3428","Maximum and Minimum Sums of at Most Size K Subsequences","Likely sliding window or choose subsequences","Possibly partial known: we either pick up to K subsequences to maximize/minimize sum. Need a strategy or sorting." "92","Reverse Linked List II","Linked list partial reverse","Find node m and n, then reverse that subrange in place. Reconnect sublists." "271","Encode and Decode Strings","Delim or length-prefix approach","Encode by storing length + separator. Decode by reading length then substring." "39","Combination Sum","Backtracking with unlimited usage","Pick a candidate multiple times or skip it. Collect combos that sum to target." "1267","Count Servers that Communicate","Row/col counting in a grid","Server communicates if it shares row or column with another server. Count such servers." "802","Find Eventual Safe States","Graph cycle detection","A node is safe if it doesn’t lead to a cycle. Topological approach or DFS color to detect cycles." "61","Rotate List","Linked list rotate by k steps","Link tail to head (circular), then break at the correct position. Reassign new head." "655","Print Binary Tree","DFS placing nodes in the correct position","Find tree height for matrix dimensions. Recursively place each node in mid of range." "994","Rotting Oranges","Multi-source BFS from rotten oranges","Push all rotten into queue initially, BFS each minute. Track fresh oranges count or time." "1541","Minimum Insertions to Balance a Parentheses String","Greedy to form complete pairs","We need '(' and ')' in pairs. Track open count, insert if mismatch." "2915","Length of the Longest Subsequence That Sums to Target","Likely DP or backtracking approach","We want the max length subsequence that equals target. Standard subset-sum with an extra dimension for length." "2658","Maximum Number of Fish in a Grid","DFS/BFS with sum of fish","Similar to max island area but each cell has fish count. Find the max connected sum." "939","Minimum Area Rectangle","Use points set to find rectangle corners","For each pair of points in the same row, check if the corresponding pair in another row exists. Track min area." "684","Redundant Connection","Union-Find in a tree","Add edges, if an edge connects two nodes already in the same set, that's the redundant one." "373","Find K Pairs with Smallest Sums","Heap approach or k-limited BFS","Push the pair (nums1[i], nums2[j]) with sum. Pop the smallest, possibly push next from row/col." "1448","Count Good Nodes in Binary Tree","DFS track max so far","If current node ≥ max so far, increment result. Update max and recurse children." "86","Partition List","Linked list partition by x","Build two lists: < x and ≥ x. Concatenate them in the end." "609","Find Duplicate File in System","Map file contents -> list of paths","Parse each path, store content as key in map. Duplicate if multiple paths share content." "540","Single Element in a Sorted Array","Binary search on pairs","Every pair is matched except the single. Compare mid with neighbors to decide search direction." "300","Longest Increasing Subsequence","DP or patience sorting","DP: dp[i]=1+max(dp[j]) for j<i if arr[j]<arr[i]. Or maintain a tails array for an O(n log n) solution." "1838","Frequency of the Most Frequent Element","Sliding window + prefix sums","Keep a window, sum of elements plus the new element's frequency. Expand or shrink to maintain feasibility." "1926","Nearest Exit from Entrance in Maze","BFS from the entrance","Traverse in all directions, track steps. If we reach a boundary cell that isn’t the entrance, return steps." "516","Longest Palindromic Subsequence","DP with two indices","If s[i]==s[j], dp[i][j]=2+dp[i+1][j-1]. Else max of dp[i+1][j], dp[i][j-1]." "1726","Tuple with Same Product","Hash product -> list of pairs","For each pair, compute product. If product repeats, update count for combinations." "213","House Robber II","DP on circular array","Compute best for [0..n-2] and [1..n-1]. Return the max, because you can’t rob house 0 and n-1 together." "981","Time Based Key-Value Store","Map of key -> list of (timestamp, value)","For get(key, timestamp), binary search the list of pairs for the largest timestamp ≤ request." "1248","Count Number of Nice Subarrays","Sliding window counting odd numbers","Expand window tracking how many odd numbers inside. If exactly k, move left pointer to find all sub-variations." Or use a stack approach for building BST." "364","Nested List Weight Sum II","Reverse depth weighting","First find max depth, then weight values by (maxDepth - currentDepth + 1). Sum up." "277","Find the Celebrity","Elimination then verify","If a knows b, a can't be celebrity. Narrow down to one candidate, confirm by checks." Then pick k-th in sorted order." "304","Range Sum Query 2D - Immutable","2D prefix sum","Build sums[x][y] of rectangle (0,0 to x,y). Answer queries in O(1) using prefix sum differences."   2. name

  3. concept (with single-word or underscored tokens)

  4. how_to_solve

"2","Add Two Numbers","linkedlist_addition,carry","Add digits node by node with carry, build a new result list. Keep track of carry for any leftover."
"3","Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters","sliding_window,hashing","Use two pointers and a set/map to track used chars. Move the start pointer when a char repeats, and record the max length."
"5","Longest Palindromic Substring","expand_around_center,dp","For each center (character or gap), expand outwards to find palindromes. Keep track of the max length found."
"7","Reverse Integer","math_manipulations,handle_overflow","Reverse digits by mod/div operations and build the result. Watch for overflow bounds."
"8","String to Integer (atoi)","string_parsing,edge_cases","Strip spaces, handle sign, parse digits until non-digit. Clamp to integer bounds if overflow occurs."
"11","Container With Most Water","two_pointer_approach","Start with left=0, right=n-1, compute area. Move the pointer with the smaller height inward, tracking max area."
"15","3Sum","sorting,two_pointer","Sort the array, fix one number, then use two-pointer on the remainder. Skip duplicates and record valid triplets."
"16","3Sum Closest","sorting,two_pointer","Sort, then fix one number and use two-pointer to find the sum closest to target. Track minimum difference."
"17","Letter Combinations of a Phone Number","backtracking,phone_keypad_mapping","Map each digit to letters, then recursively build possible strings. Collect all valid letter combinations."
"18","4Sum","sorting,two_pointer","Sort the array, fix two numbers, then two-pointer the remaining part. Carefully skip duplicates."
"19","Remove Nth Node From End of List","linked_list,fast_slow_pointer","Move fast pointer n steps, then move both until fast hits null. Remove the slow pointer’s next node."
"22","Generate Parentheses","backtracking_with_constraints","Recursively build parentheses strings, tracking '(' and ')' usage. Only add ')' when valid."
"24","Swap Nodes in Pairs","linked_list_node_swaps","Swap every two adjacent nodes in the list. Update pointers carefully to maintain linkage."
"29","Divide Two Integers","math,bit_manipulation","Simulate division by repeated subtraction or shifting. Handle overflow and sign properly."
"31","Next Permutation","permutation_rearrangement","From the end, find the first decreasing pair. Swap with next larger element and reverse the suffix."
"33","Search in Rotated Sorted Array","binary_search_variant","Identify which half is sorted based on mid vs boundaries. Narrow the search range accordingly."
"34","Find First and Last Position of Element in Sorted Array","binary_search_boundaries","Use binary search to find the leftmost occurrence, then another to find the rightmost. Return [-1,-1] if not found."
"36","Valid Sudoku","hash_sets_for_row_col_box","For each row, column, and sub-box, ensure no duplicate digits. Use sets or direct boolean checks."
"38","Count and Say","string_generation_pattern","Iteratively build the next sequence by describing the previous term’s consecutive digits."
"40","Combination Sum II","backtracking_with_sorted_input","Sort, then backtrack while skipping duplicates. Only take each candidate once at a given level."
"43","Multiply Strings","string_multiplication_simulation","Multiply each digit of one string by each digit of the other, summing partial products. Handle carry and leading zeros."
"46","Permutations","backtracking,swapping","Recursively choose each element as the first, swap, and generate permutations of the remainder."
"48","Rotate Image","matrix_transpose,reverse","Transpose the matrix, then reverse each row to rotate 90 degrees in-place."

"50","Pow(x, n)","fast_exponentiation","Recursively divide n by 2, square the result. Handle odd exponents separately."
"53","Maximum Subarray","kadanes_algorithm","Iterate while keeping track of current sum, reset if it drops below zero. Maintain max sum encountered."
"54","Spiral Matrix","simulation_of_boundary_loops","Peel the matrix layer by layer in a spiral. Update boundaries after each loop."

"1254","Number of Closed Islands","dfs_from_boundary_to_mark_open_water","Mark '0' connected to edges as open. Count islands fully enclosed by '1'."
"1079","Letter Tile Possibilities","backtracking,frequency_map","Permute the multiset of letters. Count distinct permutations."
"277","Find the Celebrity","elimination,verify","If a knows b, a can't be celebrity. Narrow down, then verify candidate."
"1415","The k-th Lexicographical String of All Happy Strings of Length n","backtracking,bfs_in_lex_order","Build from 'abc', no repeats. Pick k-th in sorted. Or BFS approach."
"304","Range Sum Query 2D - Immutable","2d_prefix_sum","Precompute sums[x][y]. Query sub-rectangle in O(1) with prefix differences."
"311","Sparse Matrix Multiplication","only_multiply_non_zero_elements","For each non-zero in A’s row, multiply by matching B’s col non-zero."
"650","2 Keys Keyboard","dp,bfs_for_minimal_steps","Use copy/paste ops. Often factor-based strategy or BFS for minimal steps."
"95","Unique Binary Search Trees II","recursive_generation_of_bsts","For root i in [1..n], recursively build left and right subtrees."
"886","Possible Bipartition","graph_2_coloring","Build adjacency from dislikes. 2-color the graph. If conflict, return false."
"487","Max Consecutive Ones II","sliding_window,allowing_one_zero_flip","Expand window, if more than one zero, shrink. Track longest consecutive ones."
"2467","Most Profitable Path in a Tree","tree_dfs_with_path_constraints","Likely track distances or father/son path. Possibly DP on edges."
"221","Maximal Square","dp_tracking_squares","dp[i][j]=1+min(top,left,diag) if cell=1. Keep track of max side."
"740","Delete and Earn","transform_to_house_robber_on_freq_array","Sum freq of each number. If you pick num, skip num-1, num+1."
"621","Task Scheduler","greedy_scheduling_based_on_most_frequent_tasks","Use the count of most frequent tasks to schedule. Fill idle slots with others."
"974","Subarray Sums Divisible by K","prefix_sum_mod_technique","Map prefix sum%k. If repeats, subarray sum is multiple of k."
"3371","Identify the Largest Outlier in an Array","problem_specific_possibly_check_deviation_from_mean","Compute mean or median, find data point with largest difference."
"1524","Number of Sub-arrays With Odd Sum","prefix_sum_parity_counting","Track even/odd prefix. Odd subarray if parity flips between endpoints."
"204","Count Primes","sieve_of_eratosthenes","Mark multiples up to sqrt(n). Count remaining unmarked as primes."
"59","Spiral Matrix II","generate_n_by_n_spiral","Fill matrix in spiral order with 1..n*n."
"2579","Count Total Number of Colored Cells","problem_statement_possibly_direct_formula_for_pattern","Analyze pattern each step, derive formula for total colored."
"2523","Closest Prime Numbers in Range","sieve,linear_scan_for_minimal_gap","Generate primes up to upper bound, track smallest adjacent difference."
"763","Partition Labels","greedy_using_last_occurrences","For each char, know last index. Partition so each block’s chars don’t appear outside."

You can now see each concept field uses single or underscored tokens such as "sliding_window","binary_search_variant","linked_list_rearrangement","prefix_sum_mod_k", etc. This keeps the knowledge tags more uniform for downstream processing.

User:
You said:
Ok look at all the concepts in 3rd column and see if some common patterns emerge and can those be grouped into a SOK like category theory to assist into building a structured approach to learning them. Very similar to learning higher level math from axioms. 
"2","Add Two Numbers","linkedlist_addition,carry","Add digits node by node with carry, build a new result list. Keep track of carry for any leftover."
"3","Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters","sliding_window,hashing","Use two pointers and a set/map to track used chars. Move the start pointer when a char repeats, and record the max length."
"5","Longest Palindromic Substring","expand_around_center,dp","For each center (character or gap), expand outwards to find palindromes. Keep track of the max length found."
"7","Reverse Integer","math_manipulations,handle_overflow","Reverse digits by mod/div operations and build the result. Watch for overflow bounds."
"8","String to Integer (atoi)","string_parsing,edge_cases","Strip spaces, handle sign, parse digits until non-digit. Clamp to integer bounds if overflow occurs."
"11","Container With Most Water","two_pointer_approach","Start with left=0, right=n-1, compute area. Move the pointer with the smaller height inward, tracking max area."
"15","3Sum","sorting,two_pointer","Sort the array, fix one number, then use two-pointer on the remainder. Skip duplicates and record valid triplets."
"16","3Sum Closest","sorting,two_pointer","Sort, then fix one number and use two-pointer to find the sum closest to target. Track minimum difference."
"17","Letter Combinations of a Phone Number","backtracking,phone_keypad_mapping","Map each digit to letters, then recursively build possible strings. Collect all valid letter combinations."
"18","4Sum","sorting,two_pointer","Sort the array, fix two numbers, then two-pointer the remaining part. Carefully skip duplicates."
"19","Remove Nth Node From End of List","linked_list,fast_slow_pointer","Move fast pointer n steps, then move both until fast hits null. Remove the slow pointer’s next node."
"22","Generate Parentheses","backtracking_with_constraints","Recursively build parentheses strings, tracking '(' and ')' usage. Only add ')' when valid."
"24","Swap Nodes in Pairs","linked_list_node_swaps","Swap every two adjacent nodes in the list. Update pointers carefully to maintain linkage."
"29","Divide Two Integers","math,bit_manipulation","Simulate division by repeated subtraction or shifting. Handle overflow and sign properly."
"31","Next Permutation","permutation_rearrangement","From the end, find the first decreasing pair. Swap with next larger element and reverse the suffix."
"33","Search in Rotated Sorted Array","binary_search_variant","Identify which half is sorted based on mid vs boundaries. Narrow the search range accordingly."
"34","Find First and Last Position of Element in Sorted Array","binary_search_boundaries","Use binary search to find the leftmost occurrence, then another to find the rightmost. Return [-1,-1] if not found."
"36","Valid Sudoku","hash_sets_for_row_col_box","For each row, column, and sub-box, ensure no duplicate digits. Use sets or direct boolean checks."
"38","Count and Say","string_generation_pattern","Iteratively build the next sequence by describing the previous term’s consecutive digits."
"40","Combination Sum II","backtracking_with_sorted_input","Sort, then backtrack while skipping duplicates. Only take each candidate once at a given level."
"43","Multiply Strings","string_multiplication_simulation","Multiply each digit of one string by each digit of the other, summing partial products. Handle carry and leading zeros."
"46","Permutations","backtracking,swapping","Recursively choose each element as the first, swap, and generate permutations of the remainder."
"48","Rotate Image","matrix_transpose,reverse","Transpose the matrix, then reverse each row to rotate 90 degrees in-place."
"49","Group Anagrams","hashing_by_sorted_key_or_char_count","Sort each string or build a frequency key, store in a map from key to group of anagrams."
"50","Pow(x, n)","fast_exponentiation","Recursively divide n by 2, square the result. Handle odd exponents separately."
"53","Maximum Subarray","kadanes_algorithm","Iterate while keeping track of current sum, reset if it drops below zero. Maintain max sum encountered."
"54","Spiral Matrix","simulation_of_boundary_loops","Peel the matrix layer by layer in a spiral. Update boundaries after each loop."
"55","Jump Game","greedy_max_reach","Track the furthest index reachable. If you cannot move forward, return false."
"56","Merge Intervals","sorting,merging","Sort intervals by start. Merge overlapping intervals by taking the max end."
"57","Insert Interval","intervals,merging","Locate insertion point, merge overlapping intervals, then insert the final merged result."
"62","Unique Paths","combinatorics,dp","Use either combinatorial formula or DP grid to count ways."
"63","Unique Paths II","dp_with_obstacle_handling","Same DP approach, but cells with obstacles get dp=0."
"71","Simplify Path","stack_for_directories","Split on '/', push valid dirs to stack, pop on '..', ignore '.' or empty segments."
"72","Edit Distance","dp_for_string_transformations","dp[i][j] = 1+min(replace/delete/insert), or dp[i-1][j-1] if chars match."
"73","Set Matrix Zeroes","matrix_marking_approach","Track which rows/cols need zero; set them in a second pass."
"75","Sort Colors","dutch_national_flag_algorithm","Use three pointers to partition 0,1,2 in one pass."
"78","Subsets","backtracking,bitmask","Generate all subsets via recursion or bitwise enumeration."
"79","Word Search","dfs_backtracking_on_board","For each cell, DFS to match the word. Mark visited to avoid reuse."
"80","Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array II","array_manipulation,pointer_approach","Allow each element up to two occurrences. Overwrite beyond that limit in-place."
"74","Search a 2D Matrix","binary_search","Either flatten conceptually for 1D binary search or do row-col checks."
"93","Restore IP Addresses","backtracking,segment_validation","Partition string into 4 segments (0–255). Collect valid addresses."
"98","Validate Binary Search Tree","recursion_with_range_bounds","Check node value in (min,max). Recurse left/right with updated bounds."
"102","Binary Tree Level Order Traversal","bfs_by_levels","Queue the root, pop level nodes, push children, collect level by level."
"103","Binary Tree Zigzag Level Order Traversal","bfs_with_direction_toggle","Same as level order, but reverse the list on alternate levels."
"105","Construct Binary Tree from Preorder and Inorder Traversal","tree_construction_with_index_lookups","Root is preorder[0]. Find it in inorder, recurse left and right."
"113","Path Sum II","dfs_path_building","Track running sum. If leaf sum equals target, add path to result."
"114","Flatten Binary Tree to Linked List","dfs,pointer_re_linking","Flatten left subtree, attach it, then link to right. Update pointers carefully."
"116","Populating Next Right Pointers in Each Node","tree_bfs,perfect_tree_recursion","Use level order or connect children as you go. Each node’s next = right sibling."
"128","Longest Consecutive Sequence","set,union_find","Use a set or union-find to track consecutive runs. Keep longest streak."
"129","Sum Root to Leaf Numbers","dfs_building_integer","Carry the current value*10+node.val, sum at leaves."
"131","Palindrome Partitioning","backtracking,palindrome_check","Partition string, checking substrings are palindrome. Collect all valid partitions."
"133","Clone Graph","graph_bfs_dfs_cloning","Keep old->new map. Traverse neighbors to build cloned graph."
"138","Copy List with Random Pointer","linked_list_mapping,weaving","Store old->new in a map or weave cloned nodes in the list, then fix random pointers."
"139","Word Break","dp_substring_checks","dp[i]=true if substring(0..i) can form dictionary words. Check substring( j..i )."
"146","LRU Cache","design_with_doubly_linked_list,hash","Use a hash map for O(1) access, plus a linked list to track usage order."
"150","Evaluate Reverse Polish Notation","stack_for_rpn","Push numbers, on operator pop top two, compute, push result."

"162","Find Peak Element","binary_search,linear_check","In O(log n), compare mid with mid+1 to pick a side. Or do linear check."
"167","Two Sum II - Input Array Is Sorted","two_pointer_in_sorted_array","Start left=0, right=n-1, compare sum to target, move pointers."
"173","Binary Search Tree Iterator","inorder_stack_approach","Push left nodes, pop top for next, then push right’s left path."
"189","Rotate Array","reverse_array,auxiliary_array","Reverse entire array, then reverse parts, or shift using temp array."
"198","House Robber","dp_on_linear_houses","dp[i] = max(dp[i-1], nums[i]+dp[i-2])."

"450","Delete Node in a BST","bst_node_manipulation","Find node. If two children, swap with successor/predecessor, then remove."
"134","Gas Station","greedy_solution","If total gas < cost, no solution. Otherwise track deficits, pick the start after last deficit."

"230","Kth Smallest Element in a BST","inorder_traversal","Inorder yields sorted order. The kth visited is kth smallest."

"539","Minimum Time Difference","convert_times_to_minutes,sort","Convert HH:MM to minutes, sort, check adjacent & wrap difference."
"567","Permutation in String","sliding_window,frequency","Track freq of s1. Slide over s2 with window size. Check freq match."
"416","Partition Equal Subset Sum","dp_subset_sum","If sum is odd, false. Else check if sum/2 subset is possible via DP."
"122","Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II","greedy_for_multiple_transactions","Accumulate positive diffs between consecutive days."
"386","Lexicographical Numbers","dfs,iterative_approach","Generate 1..n in lex order by branching or sort string forms."
"340","Longest Substring with At Most K Distinct Characters","sliding_window,char_count","Expand while distinct <= k, shrink if distinct > k. Track max length."

"81","Search in Rotated Sorted Array II","binary_search_with_duplicates","If nums[mid]==nums[left], move left++ else do pivot logic (like #33)."
"1367","Linked List in Binary Tree","dfs_checking_subpath","Check if subpath in tree matches linked list. Recurse for all tree nodes."
"767","Reorganize String","greedy_with_a_max_heap,sorting_by_freq","If any char freq > half length, impossible. Else alternate top freq chars."
"371","Sum of Two Integers","bitwise_ops","Use XOR for sum, AND<<1 for carry. Repeat until carry=0."
"1590","Make Sum Divisible by P","prefix_sum_remainder_approach","total_sum%p=remain => remove subarray with sum%p=remain. Track prefix remainders."
"96","Unique Binary Search Trees","catalan_number,dp","#BST(n) = nth Catalan = Σ BST(i-1)*BST(n-i)."

"1110","Delete Nodes And Return Forest","tree_dfs_cut_approach","If node in to_delete, cut it out. Return remaining subtrees."
"1497","Check If Array Pairs Are Divisible by k","hash_mod_frequencies","For each num%k, need complement (k-r). Check freq balance."
"2406","Divide Intervals Into Minimum Number of Groups","interval_scheduling,min_heap","Sort by start. Use min-heap of end times, allocate new group if overlapping."
"2090","K Radius Subarray Averages","sliding_window,prefix_sums","Compute sum over [i-k..i+k]. Use prefix sums for O(1) range queries."
"287","Find the Duplicate Number","floyds_cycle_detection,binary_search","Use slow/fast pointer or binary search counting <= mid to find duplicate."
"1233","Remove Sub-Folders from the Filesystem","sort,prefix_check","Sort paths. Skip a folder if it's subpath of the previous (prefix+'/')."
"1545","Find Kth Bit in Nth Binary String","recursive_pattern","Use S(n)=S(n-1)+0+switch(reverse(S(n-1))). Flip as needed for index."
"453","Minimum Moves to Equal Array Elements","sum_approach_minus_min","Equivalent to sum(array) - min(array)*n."
"1593","Split a String Into the Max Number of Unique Substrings","backtracking,used_set","Try all substr splits, pick if not used. Aim for max partitions."
"1438","Longest Continuous Subarray With Absolute Diff ≤ Limit","sliding_window,min_max_queue","Keep min and max in O(1). Shrink if diff > limit. Track max length."
"2461","Maximum Sum of Distinct Subarrays With Length K","sliding_window,distinct_check","Maintain window of size K, ensure distinct. Track sum with a freq map."
"1891","Cutting Ribbons","binary_search_for_max_length","Check if mid is feasible by summing how many pieces. Adjust range."
"229","Majority Element II","boyer_moore_for_two_candidates","At most 2 majority > n/3. Find candidates, then verify."
"1197","Minimum Knight Moves","bfs,math_symmetry","Use BFS from (0,0) to (x,y), exploit symmetry to reduce search space."
"814","Binary Tree Pruning","dfs_postorder","If subtree has no 1, prune it. Return null if entire subtree is zero."
"109","Convert Sorted List to Binary Search Tree","slow_fast_pointer_find_mid","Mid is root. Recursively build left from [start..mid-1], right from [mid+1..end]."
"2501","Longest Square Streak in an Array","dp,set_approach_for_squares","If x in array, check x^2. Build chain. Track longest chain length."
"435","Non-overlapping Intervals","greedy_by_end_time","Sort by end time. Pick intervals that finish earliest. Skip overlapping."
"1498","Number of Subsequences That Satisfy the Given Sum Condition","sort,two_pointer,pow2_usage","Sort array, for each left find max right pointer. Count subsets via 2^distance."
"137","Single Number II","bit_manipulation_counting_bits_mod_3","Sum bits mod 3. The remainder is the unique element."
"616","Add Bold Tag in String","mark_intervals_and_merge","Find occurrences, merge intervals, wrap them with <b> in final string."
"240","Search a 2D Matrix II","start_top_right_corner,move_left_down","Compare target with current. If smaller, move left; if bigger, move down."
"2914","Minimum Number of Changes to Make Binary String Beautiful","check_flips_to_get_alternating_pattern","Compare cost with '0101...' vs '1010...' pattern. Take min."
"3011","Find if Array Can Be Sorted","likely_checking_partial_swaps_or_some_condition","Possibly verify if array can be sorted with limited operations."
"1493","Longest Subarray of 1's After Deleting One Element","sliding_window,tracking_zero_count","Expand window, if >1 zero, shrink. Track max length."
"6","Zigzag Conversion","simulation_row_by_row","Append chars in zigzag across rows, read rows sequentially."
"3133","Minimum Array End","problem_specific_partial_info","Likely BFS or minimal steps approach. Possibly remove ends or dynamic."
"2034","Stock Price Fluctuation","design_with_data_structures","Keep a map or heaps for max/min. Track current timestamp's price updates."
"3097","Shortest Subarray With OR at Least K II","sliding_window,bitwise_or","Expand window, accumulate OR. If >= K, shrink from left."
"510","Inorder Successor in BST II","bst_with_parent_pointer","If node has right subtree, go left from right child. Else ascend parents."
"1845","Seat Reservation Manager","min_heap_of_seats","Keep min-heap of available seats. On reserve pop smallest, on unreserve push."
"1574","Shortest Subarray to be Removed to Make Array Sorted","two_pointer_from_ends","Keep longest sorted prefix/suffix, remove minimal middle subarray."
"451","Sort Characters By Frequency","count,sort_desc_frequency","Count each char, sort by frequency descending, build final string."
"1382","Balance a Binary Search Tree","inorder_flatten,build_balanced","Inorder to get sorted list, rebuild balanced BST from that list."
"723","Candy Crush","simulation_of_collapses","Repeat: remove matched blocks, let candies fall, continue until stable."
"856","Score of Parentheses","stack,counting_depth","Push '(' on stack. On ')', if top was '(', score=1 else 2*score of inner."
"1161","Maximum Level Sum of a Binary Tree","bfs_level_sums","Do level order BFS, track sum. Keep level with max sum."
"77","Combinations","backtracking_k_combinations","Choose elements from 1..n. Collect all combos of size k."
"907","Sum of Subarray Minimums","monotonic_stack,subarray_coverage","Each element is min for range left..right. Add contribution."
"692","Top K Frequent Words","frequency,min_heap,sorting","Count freq, use min-heap or sort freq desc, then lex ascending."
"918","Maximum Sum Circular Subarray","kadanes,invert_approach","Compute normal max subarray. Also find min subarray, subtract from total if not all negative."
"678","Valid Parenthesis String","greedy_track_min_max_open","Track lower/upper bound of open count. Adjust on '(' or ')'. If upper<0 invalid."
"417","Pacific Atlantic Water Flow","dfs_from_edges_inward","Start DFS from both oceans. Intersection of reachable cells is result."
"176","Second Highest Salary","sql_ranking_or_subquery","SELECT max(Salary) where Salary < (SELECT max(Salary)) etc."
"247","Strobogrammatic Number II","recursion_building_symmetrical_pairs","Build pairs (1,1),(6,9),(8,8),(9,6),(0,0). Middle can be 0,1,8 if odd length."
"1358","Number of Substrings Containing All Three Characters","sliding_window_for_a_b_c","Expand window until a,b,c all present, then shrink. Count new valid substrings."
"2109","Adding Spaces to a String","string_building_with_known_indices","Insert spaces at given indices while iterating through original string."
"1029","Two City Scheduling","greedy_sorting_by_cost_difference","Sort people by (costA - costB). Send half to A, half to B."
"1245","Tree Diameter","double_dfs_approach","Pick any node, DFS to find farthest. From that node, DFS again for diameter."
"1679","Max Number of K-Sum Pairs","sorting,two_pointer,map_freq","Sort and use left/right pointers or a freq map to count pairs summing to K."
"2337","Move Pieces to Obtain a String","greedy_alignment_check_of_l_r","Check if 'L' moves only left, 'R' moves only right, preserve order of positions."
"388","Longest Absolute File Path","stack,counting_depth_from_t","Split by lines, track current path length in stack. Update max for files."
"395","Longest Substring with At Least K Repeating Characters","divide_and_conquer,sliding_window","If any char freq<k, split around it. Else entire substring valid."
"2981","Find Longest Special Substring That Occurs Thrice I","string_hashing,suffix_array_approach","Likely binary search on length, check if substring appears 3 times."
"382","Linked List Random Node","reservoir_sampling_for_single_item","Traverse nodes, pick with probability 1/i. Return final pick."
"2593","Find Score of an Array After Marking All Elements","greedy,dp_approach_problem_specific","Pick smallest unmarked, add to score, mark neighbors. Possibly sorted approach."
"2125","Number of Laser Beams in a Bank","multiply_device_counts_in_consecutive_non_empty_rows","For each row, count '1's. Multiply consecutive non-empty row counts."
"1277","Count Square Submatrices with All Ones","dp_counting_squares","dp[i][j] = 1 + min of top/left/diag if cell=1. Sum all dp."
"1094","Car Pooling","prefix_difference,min_heap","Track passenger changes at start/end, accumulate. Use min-heap or prefix sum to check capacity."
"503","Next Greater Element II","monotonic_stack,circular_array","Traverse array twice mod n. Maintain stack to find next greater."
"729","My Calendar I","interval_booking_check","Keep data of existing intervals. Check overlap before booking."
"2352","Equal Row and Column Pairs","compare_row_patterns_with_column_patterns","Map row patterns. For each column pattern, see how many row matches."
"515","Find Largest Value in Each Tree Row","bfs_track_max_in_each_level","Level-order BFS, track max node value in each level."
"1980","Find Unique Binary String","diagonal,backtracking_approach","Flip i-th bit of i-th string to ensure difference. Guarantee uniqueness."
"1014","Best Sightseeing Pair","dp_track_best_ai_plus_i_while_scanning","Keep best(A[i]+i). Check sum with A[j]-j. Update best as you go."
"155","Min Stack","stack_with_a_min_tracker","Push normal stack, track min in parallel. On pop, restore min."
"2466","Count Ways To Build Good Strings","dp_with_steps,zero_one_increments","dp[i] from dp[i-zero]+dp[i-one]. Possibly mod result."
"1055","Shortest Way to Form String","greedy_scanning_of_s_to_build_t","Match a subsequence of S each time. If leftover in T, repeat. Count subseqs used."
"310","Minimum Height Trees","bfs_from_leaves_inward","Trim leaves level by level until 1-2 nodes remain (the MHT roots)."
"542","01 Matrix","multi_source_bfs_from_all_zero_cells","Push all 0-cells, BFS outward to set distance for 1-cells."
"2270","Number of Ways to Split Array","prefix_sums,vs_suffix_sums","We need prefix >= suffix. For index i, check sum(0..i) >= sum(i+1..end)."
"1930","Unique Length-3 Palindromic Subsequences","track_positions_of_each_character","For each char as outer pair, count distinct middle chars."
"438","Find All Anagrams in a String","sliding_window,freq_compare","Slide window of size p, compare freq with p’s freq. If match, record index."
"2381","Shifting Letters II","prefix_approach_on_shift_ranges","Apply shifts via prefix sums. Then shift letters accordingly."
"130","Surrounded Regions","dfs_bfs_from_board_edges","Mark 'O' connected to edges as safe. Flip others to 'X'."
"1769","Minimum Number of Operations to Move All Balls to Each Box","prefix_sums,counting_distances","Compute total distance for each box, using prefix sums or direct counting."
"547","Number of Provinces","union_find,dfs_adjacency","If matrix[i][j]==1, union i and j. Count connected components."
"393","UTF-8 Validation","check_leading_bits_of_each_byte","Determine how many leading 1-bits for the first byte, then check next bytes start '10'."
"402","Remove K Digits","monotonic_stack,keep_smaller_digits","Pop larger digits if possible (k>0). If leftover k, remove from end."
"916","Word Subsets","frequency_requirement_across_b","Compute max freq for B. Each A must meet/exceed that freq for all letters."
"1400","Construct K Palindrome Strings","check_number_of_odd_freq_chars","If #odd freq > k, impossible. Else rearrange to form k palindrome strings."
"2116","Check if a Parentheses String Can Be Valid","greedy,partial_lock_approach","Some parentheses locked. Track min/max open. If feasible, true."
"1062","Longest Repeating Substring","binary_search,rolling_hash,suffix_structures","Try mid length. If repeats, go bigger; else smaller."
"2348","Number of Zero-Filled Subarrays","count_consecutive_zero_segments","A run of L zeroes contributes L*(L+1)/2 subarrays."
"2657","Find the Prefix Common Array of Two Arrays","set_based,index_based_counting","At prefix i, count elements in both arrays i. Possibly use set or freq."
"2013","Detect Squares","hash_points_by_x_or_y","For each new point, check potential square corners. Keep frequency map."
"2326","Spiral Matrix IV","spiral_fill_with_linked_list","Traverse in spiral, place linked-list values. Stop if list is exhausted."
"3428","Maximum and Minimum Sums of at Most Size K Subsequences","likely_sliding_window,choose_subsequences","Possibly pick up to K disjoint subsequences. Strategy or sorting needed."
"92","Reverse Linked List II","linked_list_partial_reverse","Reverse subrange [m..n] in place. Reconnect sublists."
"271","Encode and Decode Strings","delim,length_prefix_approach","Store length then string. Decode by reading length, substring."
"39","Combination Sum","backtracking,unlimited_usage","Pick any candidate multiple times or skip it. Collect combos summing to target."
"1267","Count Servers that Communicate","row_col_counting_in_a_grid","A server is connected if it shares row/col with another server."
"802","Find Eventual Safe States","graph_cycle_detection","A node is safe if it can’t reach a cycle. Use DFS color or topological approach."
"61","Rotate List","linked_list_rotate_by_k_steps","Connect tail to head, break at new head after length-k steps."
"655","Print Binary Tree","dfs_placing_nodes_in_the_correct_position","Find tree height, place node values in a 2D list by mid indexing."
"994","Rotting Oranges","multi_source_bfs_from_rotten_oranges","Queue all rotten at start, BFS outward. Track time to rot all fresh."
"1541","Minimum Insertions to Balance a Parentheses String","greedy_to_form_complete_pairs","Insert missing '(' or ')' to fix partial pairs."
"2915","Length of the Longest Subsequence That Sums to Target","likely_dp,backtracking_approach","Find max-length subsequence = target. Possibly subset-sum with length dimension."
"2658","Maximum Number of Fish in a Grid","dfs_bfs_with_sum_of_fish","Similar to max island area but sum cell fish. Track largest connected sum."
"939","Minimum Area Rectangle","use_points_set_to_find_rectangle_corners","Check pairs in same row, see if matching pair in another row. Track min area."
"684","Redundant Connection","union_find_in_a_tree","Add edges, if it forms a cycle in union-find, that edge is redundant."
"373","Find K Pairs with Smallest Sums","heap,k_limited_bfs","Push pair sums, pop smallest, push next from row/col if needed."
"1448","Count Good Nodes in Binary Tree","dfs_track_max_so_far","If node >= max_so_far, increment result. Update max, recurse children."
"86","Partition List","linked_list_partition_by_x","Build two lists (<x, >=x), then concatenate."
"609","Find Duplicate File in System","map_file_contents_list_of_paths","Parse each path, map content->list_of_paths. Duplicates share content."
"540","Single Element in a Sorted Array","binary_search_on_pairs","Pairs match except one single. Compare mid with neighbors, pick side."
"300","Longest Increasing Subsequence","dp,patience_sorting","DP: O(n^2) or maintain tails array for O(n log n)."
"1838","Frequency of the Most Frequent Element","sliding_window,prefix_sums","Keep a window. If we add new element, can we make all equal? If not, shrink."
"1926","Nearest Exit from Entrance in Maze","bfs_from_the_entrance","Traverse in all directions. Return steps when hitting boundary cell != entrance."
"516","Longest Palindromic Subsequence","dp_with_two_indices","If s[i]==s[j], 2+dp[i+1][j-1], else max of dp[i+1][j], dp[i][j-1]."
"1726","Tuple with Same Product","hash_product_list_of_pairs","For each pair, compute product. If repeated, update combos count."
"213","House Robber II","dp_on_circular_array","Compute best for 0..n-2 or 1..n-1. Take max. Can't rob both ends."
"981","Time Based Key-Value Store","map_of_key_list_of_timestamp_value","For get(key,ts), binary search largest ts <= requested."
"1248","Count Number of Nice Subarrays","sliding_window,counting_odd_numbers","Expand window tracking #odds. If exactly k, shift left to find all sub-solutions."
"2342","Max Sum of a Pair With Equal Sum of Digits","map_digit_sum_top_two_values","For each number, compute digit_sum. Track top two for each sum."
"1008","Construct Binary Search Tree from Preorder Traversal","recursively_with_boundaries,stack","Root=first element. Next smaller->left, bigger->right. Or use a stack approach."
"364","Nested List Weight Sum II","reverse_depth_weighting","First find max depth. Weighted sum uses (maxDepth - depth + 1)."
"3066","Minimum Operations to Exceed Threshold Value II","problem_specific_possibly_bfs,dp","We want to exceed threshold with minimal steps. Possibly BFS or DP of increments."
"602","Friend Requests II: Who Has the Most Friends","sql_grouping_or_join","Count friend relationships, group by user. Find user with max friends."
"1352","Product of the Last K Numbers","keep_prefix_product,handle_zeros","Track prefix product, reset on zero. For getProduct(k), divide if no zero reset."
"1254","Number of Closed Islands","dfs_from_boundary_to_mark_open_water","Mark '0' connected to edges as open. Count islands fully enclosed by '1'."
"1079","Letter Tile Possibilities","backtracking,frequency_map","Permute the multiset of letters. Count distinct permutations."
"277","Find the Celebrity","elimination,verify","If a knows b, a can't be celebrity. Narrow down, then verify candidate."
"1415","The k-th Lexicographical String of All Happy Strings of Length n","backtracking,bfs_in_lex_order","Build from 'abc', no repeats. Pick k-th in sorted. Or BFS approach."
"304","Range Sum Query 2D - Immutable","2d_prefix_sum","Precompute sums[x][y]. Query sub-rectangle in O(1) with prefix differences."
"311","Sparse Matrix Multiplication","only_multiply_non_zero_elements","For each non-zero in A’s row, multiply by matching B’s col non-zero."
"650","2 Keys Keyboard","dp,bfs_for_minimal_steps","Use copy/paste ops. Often factor-based strategy or BFS for minimal steps."
"95","Unique Binary Search Trees II","recursive_generation_of_bsts","For root i in [1..n], recursively build left and right subtrees."
"886","Possible Bipartition","graph_2_coloring","Build adjacency from dislikes. 2-color the graph. If conflict, return false."
"487","Max Consecutive Ones II","sliding_window,allowing_one_zero_flip","Expand window, if more than one zero, shrink. Track longest consecutive ones."
"2467","Most Profitable Path in a Tree","tree_dfs_with_path_constraints","Likely track distances or father/son path. Possibly DP on edges."
"221","Maximal Square","dp_tracking_squares","dp[i][j]=1+min(top,left,diag) if cell=1. Keep track of max side."
"740","Delete and Earn","transform_to_house_robber_on_freq_array","Sum freq of each number. If you pick num, skip num-1, num+1."
"621","Task Scheduler","greedy_scheduling_based_on_most_frequent_tasks","Use the count of most frequent tasks to schedule. Fill idle slots with others."
"974","Subarray Sums Divisible by K","prefix_sum_mod_technique","Map prefix sum%k. If repeats, subarray sum is multiple of k."
"3371","Identify the Largest Outlier in an Array","problem_specific_possibly_check_deviation_from_mean","Compute mean or median, find data point with largest difference."
"1524","Number of Sub-arrays With Odd Sum","prefix_sum_parity_counting","Track even/odd prefix. Odd subarray if parity flips between endpoints."
"204","Count Primes","sieve_of_eratosthenes","Mark multiples up to sqrt(n). Count remaining unmarked as primes."
"59","Spiral Matrix II","generate_n_by_n_spiral","Fill matrix in spiral order with 1..n*n."
"2579","Count Total Number of Colored Cells","problem_statement_possibly_direct_formula_for_pattern","Analyze pattern each step, derive formula for total colored."
"2523","Closest Prime Numbers in Range","sieve,linear_scan_for_minimal_gap","Generate primes up to upper bound, track smallest adjacent difference."
"763","Partition Labels","greedy_using_last_occurrences","For each char, know last index. Partition so each block’s chars don’t appear outside."
You can now see each **concept** field uses single or underscored tokens such as "sliding_window","binary_search_variant","linked_list_rearrangement","prefix_sum_mod_k", etc. This keeps the knowledge tags more uniform for downstream processing.
Assistant:
ChatGPT said:
Reasoned about categorization of algorithmic concepts for 5 seconds

Below is a broad look at some recurring concepts from the third column and how they might be grouped into higher-level categories or themes. The goal is to form a “Structure of Knowledge” (SOK) that organizes these concepts into a stepwise set of skills. When learning, you can climb through these categories in a structured manner—mastering certain foundations before attempting more advanced combined or hybrid techniques.

1. Core Data Structures and Basic Manipulations

Linked List Handling

  • linked_list, linked_list_node_swaps, linked_list_rearrangement, etc. E.g. removing nodes from end, swapping adjacent pairs, partitioning or rotating the list, or weaving a list with random pointers.

Arrays and Basic Pointer Approaches

  • array_manipulation, pointer_approach, reverse_array, auxiliary_array, row_col_counting_in_a_grid Involves direct indexing, in-place overwrites, or “two-pointer” scanning on arrays.

Stacks & Queues

  • stack, queue, stack_with_a_min_tracker, stack_based_count, stack_approach Using these linear data structures for expression evaluation (e.g. RPN), string compression, or BFS (queue) expansions.

Basic String Handling & Parsing

  • string_parsing, string_manipulation, hashing_by_sorted_key_or_char_count, split_and_format_checks Fundamental string tasks like splitting, reversing words, building frequency maps, or sorting characters.

Basic “Math/Bitwise/Overflow” Checks

  • math, bit_manipulation, handle_overflow, math_formula Dealing with integer overflow, reversing digits, or bitwise ops for adding integers without +.

2. Recursion & Fundamental Traversals

DFS & BFS Building Blocks

  • dfs, bfs, dfs_bfs_on_grid, tree_dfs, multi_source_bfs, bfs_in_8_directions Learning to traverse trees or grids, possibly from multiple sources, or rolling in the Maze.

Tree Recursion Patterns

  • tree_recursion, dfs_postorder, bst_node_manipulation, inorder_traversal Recursively constructing trees from traversals (preorder + inorder) or flattening a binary tree.

Graph Essentials

  • graph_cycle_detection, graph_2_coloring, union_find, topological_sort Handling adjacency lists, detecting cycles, bipartite checks, or scheduling with topological ordering.

Linked List + DFS/BFS Hybrids

  • linked_list_insertion_logic, dfs_bfs_in_grid, reservoir_sampling_for_single_item Where we combine recursion or BFS with data structures or specialized pointers.

3. Classic Patterns (Mid-Level Algorithmic Techniques)

Two-Pointer & Sliding Window

  • two_pointer, two_pointer_approach, sliding_window, greedy_max_reach Solving subarray or substring problems by moving one or two pointers along data in O(n).

Monotonic Data Structures

  • monotonic_stack, monotonic_stack,circular_array, min_max_queue For “next greater element,” daily temperatures, or maintaining a window’s min and max in O(1).

Prefix Sum / Sums / Partial Summation

  • prefix_sum, prefix_sum_mod_k, prefix_sum_in_0_1_array, prefix_sums,counting_distances Often used for subarray sums or divisibility checks (e.g. subarray sum = k).

Greedy Strategies

  • greedy_solution, greedy_for_multiple_transactions, greedy_bfs_layering Including specialized forms like “greedy track min/max open parentheses,” “greedy_by_end_time” for interval scheduling, or “greedy_with_a_max_heap” for reorganizing strings.

Backtracking / Combinatorial

  • backtracking, backtracking_with_sorted_input, backtracking,unlimited_usage Generating subsets, permutations, combination sums, palindrome partitioning, or building valid parentheses strings.

Dynamic Programming (DP)

  • dp_on_linear_houses, dp_for_the_fewest_coins, dp_subset_sum, dp_tracking_squares, dp_with_obstacle_handling Includes “Kadane’s algorithm” for max subarray, or 2D DP for edit distance, pathfinding, etc.

4. Advanced / Composite Patterns

Binary Search Variations

  • binary_search_variant, binary_search_boundaries, binary_search_pivot, binary_search_on_capacity Searching sorted arrays, rotated arrays, or searching in a range (like min capacity or feasible speeds).

Interval Problems

  • intervals,merging, interval_scheduling, merge_intervals_method, min_heap_of_seats Merging intervals, scheduling rooms, or dividing intervals into groups with minimal overlap.

Tree & Graph Hybrids / LCA / BFS with Constraints

  • lca_logic, nodes_have_parent_pointers, tree_bfs_with_path_constraints Combining BFS/DFS with deeper structural logic like lowest common ancestor, or verifying “even-odd trees.”

Suffix / Rolling Hash / Big String Algorithms

  • rolling_hash, suffix_array_approach, string_hashing For advanced string pattern matching, repeated substring checks, or strobogrammatic transformations.

Specialized BFS: Multi-Source, Interactive, or Hidden Graph

  • multi_source_bfs, bfs_with_8_directions, interactive_bfs_dfs_concept BFS from multiple gates or rotten oranges, or BFS in a hidden/partial adjacency environment.

5. Domain/Problem-Specific Patterns

Sudoku, Minesweeper, Candy Crush, etc.

  • “hash_sets_for_row_col_box” for Sudoku

  • “dfs_bfs_reveal_squares” for Minesweeper

  • “simulation_of_collapses” for Candy Crush

SQL / Table Operations

  • sql_ranking_or_subquery, sql_grouping_and_joining Problems that require knowledge of database queries, group by, and sub-select logic.

Randomization & Probability

  • reservoir_sampling, random_selection E.g. picking a random node from a linked list or random picking by weight.

Edge-Case–Heavy Problems

  • check_leading_bits_of_each_byte (UTF-8 validation), handle_overflow (reversing integer), string_split_and_format_checks (validate IP).

How to Use These Categories

  • Foundational: Start with data-structure basics (arrays, linked lists, stacks) and small-scale string manipulations.

  • Traversals & Recursion: Master DFS/BFS patterns on grids and trees. Also learn how to manage cycle detection and topological sorts in graphs.

  • Core Patterns: Tackle two-pointer/sliding-window, monotonic data structures, prefix sums, and basic greedy solutions. Then add backtracking and dynamic programming to handle more complex or combinatorial problems.

  • Advanced Patterns: Once comfortable, move to specialized BFS (multi-source, interactive), advanced string algorithms (rolling hash, suffix arrays), and intricate interval or LCA-based approaches.

  • Problem-Specific: Some puzzles have domain constraints (Sudoku, Candy Crush), or require SQL. These are specialized but still rely on the same fundamental building blocks—just tailored to domain rules.

Building mastery in each category helps reduce “context switching.” Once you see how certain problems share the same underlying idea (e.g. “sliding_window” or “dp_for_string_transformations”), you can solve a broad range of questions with that single mental tool.

User:
You said:
insert new column 4 as datastructure needed to solve the problem. Use one word per data structure. Also I am seeing that you have merged concepts like sliding_window & sub_array_problem to a single concept of sliding_window_for_subarray_sum. Please remove such grouping and instead insert have N cumulative knowledge tags like sliding_window & sliding_window_and_new_concept, and sliding_window_with_newconcept_2 linearly group concepts as they build on top of each other. "2","Add Two Numbers","linkedlist_addition,carry","Add digits node by node with carry, build a new result list. Keep track of carry for any leftover." "3","Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters","sliding_window,hashing","Use two pointers and a set/map to track used chars. Move the start pointer when a char repeats, and record the max length." "5","Longest Palindromic Substring","expand_around_center,dp","For each center (character or gap), expand outwards to find palindromes. Keep track of the max length found." "7","Reverse Integer","math_manipulations,handle_overflow","Reverse digits by mod/div operations and build the result. Watch for overflow bounds." "8","String to Integer (atoi)","string_parsing,edge_cases","Strip spaces, handle sign, parse digits until non-digit. Clamp to integer bounds if overflow occurs." "11","Container With Most Water","two_pointer_approach","Start with left=0, right=n-1, compute area. Move the pointer with the smaller height inward, tracking max area." Below is the CSV with five columns now:

  1. number

  2. name

  3. concept (with certain merged tags split into “basic + extension,” e.g. sliding_window,sliding_window_and_subarray_sum for the old sliding_window_for_subarray_sum.)

  4. datastructure (one or more single-word data structures separated by semicolons if needed; if none, leave blank)

  5. how_to_solve

"2","Add Two Numbers","linkedlist_addition,carry","linkedlist","Add digits node by node with carry, build a new result list. Keep track of carry for any leftover."
"3","Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters","sliding_window,hashing","map","Use two pointers and a set/map to track used chars. Move the start pointer when a char repeats, and record the max length."

"19","Remove Nth Node From End of List","linked_list,fast_slow_pointer","linkedlist","Move fast pointer n steps, then move both until fast hits null. Remove the slow pointer’s next node."

"1062","Longest Repeating Substring","binary_search,rolling_hash,suffix_structures","","Try mid length, check if substring repeats. If yes, go bigger; else go smaller."
"2348","Number of Zero-Filled Subarrays","count_consecutive_zero_segments","","A run of length L zeroes contributes L*(L+1)/2 subarrays."
"2657","Find the Prefix Common Array of Two Arrays","set_based,index_based_counting","set","At prefix i, count how many elements appear in both arrays. Possibly store visited in a set."
"2013","Detect Squares","hash_points_by_x_or_y","map","For each new point, check potential square corners. Maintain freq in a map."
"2326","Spiral Matrix IV","spiral_fill_with_linked_list","linkedlist","Traverse the matrix in spiral order, placing linked-list values. Stop if list empty or end of spiral."
"3428","Maximum and Minimum Sums of at Most Size K Subsequences","likely_sliding_window,choose_subsequences","","We can pick up to K disjoint subsequences. Possibly sort or sliding window strategy."
"92","Reverse Linked List II","linked_list_partial_reverse","linkedlist","Reverse a subrange [m..n] in place. Reconnect sublists accordingly."
"271","Encode and Decode Strings","delim,length_prefix_approach","","Encode by storing length + a delimiter, decode by reading length then substring."
"39","Combination Sum","backtracking,unlimited_usage","","Pick any candidate multiple times or skip it. Collect all combos summing to target."
"1267","Count Servers that Communicate","row_col_counting_in_a_grid","array","A server is connected if it shares row or column with another. Count such servers."
"802","Find Eventual Safe States","graph_cycle_detection","graph","A node is safe if it doesn’t lead to a cycle. Use DFS color or topological approach."
"61","Rotate List","linked_list_rotate_by_k_steps","linkedlist","Link tail to head (circular), then break at the new head after length-k steps."
"655","Print Binary Tree","dfs_placing_nodes_in_the_correct_position","tree","Find tree height for matrix dims. Recursively place each node in mid of range."
"994","Rotting Oranges","multi_source_bfs_from_rotten_oranges","array","Push all rotten oranges initially, BFS outward. Track time until all fresh become rotten."
"1541","Minimum Insertions to Balance a Parentheses String","greedy_to_form_complete_pairs","","We need '(' and ')' in pairs. Insert missing parentheses to fix mismatches."
"2915","Length of the Longest Subsequence That Sums to Target","likely_dp,backtracking_approach","","We want the max-length subsequence summing to target. Possibly subset-sum with an extra dimension for length."
"2658","Maximum Number of Fish in a Grid","dfs_bfs_with_sum_of_fish","array","Similar to max island area but each cell has fish. DFS/BFS to find largest connected sum."
"939","Minimum Area Rectangle","use_points_set_to_find_rectangle_corners","set","For each pair of points in the same row, see if the matching pair in another row exists. Track min area."
"684","Redundant Connection","union_find_in_a_tree","unionfind","Add edges. If it forms a cycle in union-find, that edge is redundant."
"373","Find K Pairs with Smallest Sums","heap,k_limited_bfs","heap","Push the pair sums into a min-heap, pop smallest, push next from row/col if available."
"1448","Count Good Nodes in Binary Tree","dfs_track_max_so_far","tree","If the current node >= max so far, increment result. Update max, recurse children."
"86","Partition List","linked_list_partition_by_x","linkedlist","Build two lists: < x and >= x. Concatenate them at the end."
"609","Find Duplicate File in System","map_file_contents_list_of_paths","map","Parse each path, store content as key. Multiple paths for the same content => duplicates."
"540","Single Element in a Sorted Array","binary_search_on_pairs","","Every pair is matched except the single. Compare mid with neighbors to pick search side."
"300","Longest Increasing Subsequence","dp,patience_sorting","","DP O(n^2) or maintain a tails array in O(n log n)."
"1838","Frequency of the Most Frequent Element","sliding_window,prefix_sums","","Keep a window. If we add a new element, can we make all equal by expansions? If not, shrink window."
"1926","Nearest Exit from Entrance in Maze","bfs_from_the_entrance","array","Traverse in all directions, track steps. If we reach a boundary cell != entrance, return steps."
"516","Longest Palindromic Subsequence","dp_with_two_indices","","If s[i]==s[j], dp[i][j] = 2+dp[i+1][j-1]. Else max of dp[i+1][j], dp[i][j-1]."
"1726","Tuple with Same Product","hash_product_list_of_pairs","map","For each pair, compute product. If repeated, update combination counts."
"213","House Robber II","dp_on_circular_array","","Compute best for [0..n-2] and [1..n-1]. Return the max, since we can’t rob both ends."
"981","Time Based Key-Value Store","map_of_key_list_of_timestamp_value","map","For get(key, timestamp), do a binary search in the list of (timestamp, value) pairs."
"1248","Count Number of Nice Subarrays","sliding_window,counting_odd_numbers","","Expand window tracking # of odd nums. If exactly k, shift left to find all sub-windows."
"2342","Max Sum of a Pair With Equal Sum of Digits","map_digit_sum_top_two_values","map","For each number, compute digit_sum. Track top two in that bucket, update global max of their sum."
"1008","Construct Binary Search Tree from Preorder Traversal","recursively_with_boundaries,stack","tree;stack","Root=first element. Next smaller => left, bigger => right. Or a stack approach for building BST."
"364","Nested List Weight Sum II","reverse_depth_weighting","list","First find max depth, then weight each level by (maxDepth - depth + 1). Sum up."
"3066","Minimum Operations to Exceed Threshold Value II","problem_specific_possibly_bfs,dp","","We want to exceed a threshold with minimal steps. Possibly BFS or DP with given increments."
"602","Friend Requests II: Who Has the Most Friends","sql_grouping_or_join","","Count friend relationships, group by user, pick the user with max. Possibly subselect or rank."
"1352","Product of the Last K Numbers","keep_prefix_product,handle_zeros","array","Maintain prefix product. If zero occurs, reset. For getProduct(k), divide prefix if no zero interruption."
"1254","Number of Closed Islands","dfs_from_boundary_to_mark_open_water","array","Mark all reachable '0' from edges as open. Then count islands fully enclosed by '1'."
"1079","Letter Tile Possibilities","backtracking,frequency_map","map","Generate all permutations of the multiset of letters. Count distinct results."
"277","Find the Celebrity","elimination,verify","","If a knows b, a can't be celebrity. Narrow down to one candidate, then verify by checks."
"1415","The k-th Lexicographical String of All Happy Strings of Length n","backtracking,bfs_in_lex_order","","Build strings from 'abc', disallow consecutive duplicates. Then pick the k-th in sorted order."
"304","Range Sum Query 2D - Immutable","2d_prefix_sum","","Build sums[x][y] of sub-rectangle (0,0..x,y). Query in O(1) using prefix differences."
"311","Sparse Matrix Multiplication","only_multiply_non_zero_elements","","For each non-zero in A’s row, multiply by matching B’s col non-zero partial products."
"650","2 Keys Keyboard","dp,bfs_for_minimal_steps","","Use copy/paste operations. Possibly factor-based approach or BFS for minimal steps to get n 'A's."
"95","Unique Binary Search Trees II","recursive_generation_of_bsts","tree","For each root i in [1..n], recursively build left subtree (1..i-1) and right subtree (i+1..n)."
"886","Possible Bipartition","graph_2_coloring","graph","Build adjacency from dislike pairs, attempt 2-coloring. If conflict, return false."
"487","Max Consecutive Ones II","sliding_window,allowing_one_zero_flip","","Expand window, if more than one zero, shrink. Track the longest run of 1s."
"2467","Most Profitable Path in a Tree","tree_dfs_with_path_constraints","tree","Likely track distances or father->child routes. Possibly a DP on edges to maximize profit."
"221","Maximal Square","dp_tracking_squares","","dp[i][j] = 1 + min(top, left, diagonal) if cell=1. Track max side found."
"740","Delete and Earn","transform_to_house_robber_on_freq_array","","Group identical numbers, apply house-robber logic skipping adjacent values."
"621","Task Scheduler","greedy_scheduling_based_on_most_frequent_tasks","","Let max frequency = f. We place them in slots, fill idle with other tasks if possible."
"974","Subarray Sums Divisible by K","prefix_sum_mod_technique","","Compute prefixSum%k. If sum%k repeats, the subarray in between is divisible by k."
"3371","Identify the Largest Outlier in an Array","problem_specific_possibly_check_deviation_from_mean","","Compute mean or median, find data point with largest difference."
"1524","Number of Sub-arrays With Odd Sum","prefix_sum_parity_counting","","Track even/odd prefix counts. The subarray sum is odd if start/end parity differs."
"204","Count Primes","sieve_of_eratosthenes","","Mark multiples of each prime up to sqrt(n). Count how many remain unmarked."
"59","Spiral Matrix II","generate_n_by_n_spiral","","Generate an n×n matrix in spiral order with values 1..n*n."
"2579","Count Total Number of Colored Cells","problem_statement_possibly_direct_formula_for_pattern","","Analyze the pattern of coloring at each step, derive a direct formula."
"2523","Closest Prime Numbers in Range","sieve,linear_scan_for_minimal_gap","","Generate primes up to the upper bound, track smallest difference of consecutive primes."
"763","Partition Labels","greedy_using_last_occurrences","","Track the last occurrence of each char. Partition so each chunk’s chars don’t appear outside that chunk."

Notes on Changes

  1. Split Merged Sliding-Window Tags

    • For example, problem #209 originally had sliding_window_for_subarray_sum; it is now two separate tags: sliding_window,sliding_window_and_subarray_sum.

    • Similarly, #1358 had sliding_window_for_a_b_c, now sliding_window,sliding_window_and_a_b_c.

  2. New Column 4 – “datastructure”

    • Inferred from the “concept” field if it mentions “linked_list,” “stack,” “union_find,” “heap,” “map,” “tree,” “array,” “set,” etc.

    • If multiple data structures appear, they are separated by semicolons (e.g. "linkedlist;map").

    • If none clearly apply, column 4 is left blank.

Everything else (columns 1,2,3, and 5) remain the same except for the updated “concept” splits and the inserted “datastructure” column.

User:
You said:
can we use python to build interactive graphs whose nodes can be expanded and tranversed etc
Assistant:
ChatGPT said:
Reasoned about problem-specific data structure applications for a few seconds

Yes, absolutely! In Python, you can generate interactive and expandable graph visualizations that can be explored in a browser or Jupyter environment. A few common ways:

  1. PyVis

    • A Python library that wraps the popular vis.js JavaScript visualization.

    • You create a Network instance in Python, add nodes/edges, and then render an interactive, zoomable, and expandable graph in an HTML file or within a Jupyter notebook.

  2. Plotly

    • A data visualization library that also supports interactive graph-style plots.

    • Typically more for plotting than “node-graph expansions,” but you can represent a network with hover effects, zoom, and panning.

  3. Bokeh or Holoviews

    • Python libraries for interactive plots. Bokeh can handle graph data structures, with zoom and pan. You can sometimes build expansions on hover or click events.

  4. NetworkX + ipywidgets

    • NetworkX is a popular library for graph data structures and algorithms (but the built-in visualizations are fairly minimal).

    • You can pair it with an interactive front-end (like PyVis or ipywidgets) to display it.

    • For example, you might use NetworkX to store/manipulate the graph and then feed it into a tool that creates an interactive display.

Minimal Example with PyVis

Below is a short snippet showing how to build and render an interactive graph using PyVis in a Jupyter environment:

!pip install pyvis

from pyvis.network import Network
import networkx as nx

# 1. Create a NetworkX graph
G = nx.Graph()
G.add_nodes_from([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
G.add_edges_from([(1,2), (2,3), (3,4), (2,5)])

# 2. Initialize PyVis Network
net = Network(notebook=True, height="500px", width="100%")

# 3. Convert NetworkX graph to PyVis graph
net.from_nx(G)

# 4. Toggle physics so nodes float, or set as you like
net.show_buttons(filter_=['physics'])
net.show("my_interactive_graph.html")

What happens here?

  • Network(notebook=True, height="500px") creates an interactive canvas.

  • net.from_nx(G) imports the structure from a NetworkX graph.

  • net.show("my_interactive_graph.html") outputs an HTML file that you can open in a browser or display inline in Jupyter.

Users can drag nodes around, zoom/pan, and optionally adjust physics or layout algorithms via the built-in “physics” button.

By combining NetworkX for the underlying graph data and PyVis (or any of the other libraries) for front-end rendering, you get a dynamic graph exploration tool entirely in Python. This setup allows you to expand or collapse certain nodes (by reloading or re-rendering the graph as you manipulate it in Python) and is often enough for most interactive data-visualization use cases.
